name: 1942 Tetrimino - Outer Space - M5StickC Plus2
description:
🎮 1942 Tetrimino Edition
For M5StickC Plus2 With a Mini JoyC Hat!

A modern tribute to Capcom's classic 1942 arcade shooter, reimagined with Tetris-inspired visuals for the M5StickC Plus2. Pilot your T-piece fighter through endless waves of Tetrimino enemies, collect power-ups, battle massive bosses, and see how long you can survive!

Game Screenshot Intense arcade action with Tetrimino-style enemies

✨ Features
🎯 Auto-Fire System
Toggle with Button A - No more button mashing!
Accessibility feature for extended play sessions
Visual "AUTO" indicator on HUD
👾 20 Different Enemy Types
6 Tetriminos: I, O, L, J, S, Z pieces
6 TETRIS Letters: T-E-T-R-I-S spelling out in sequence
8 Strange Symbols: Plus, Diamond, Arrow, Heart, and more
Large variants for extra challenge
🔥 Power-Up System
Collect "P" pickups spawning every 20-45 seconds
Stack up to 3 levels (6 wing guns total!)
Power-ups act as shields before losing lives
---Wing guns--- x3 max
🦾 Progressive Boss Scaling
Boss battle every 60 seconds
Size scales from 2x to 8x (screen-filling!)
Health scales infinitely (+5 HP per wave)
Fire rate maxes at Wave 4 (bullet hell mode!)
📊 End-Game Statistics
Detailed performance tracking:

Total score
Wave reached
Shots fired
Enemies killed
Accuracy percentage
📈 Smooth Difficulty Progression
All metrics scale smoothly with safety caps:

Enemy speed: 1.0x → 3.0x (maxed at Wave 14)
Spawn rate: 1200ms → 600ms (maxed at Wave 7)
Enemy fire: 1000ms → 400ms (maxed at Wave 13)
Boss fire: 500ms → 200ms (maxed at Wave 4)
Boss size: 2.0x → 8.0x (maxed at Wave 13)
Boss health: 20 HP → ∞ (never caps!)
🎮 Gameplay
Wave Structure
Waves 1-5: Regular Tetriminos with progressive difficulty
Wave 6: TETRIS letters + strange symbols appear
Wave 7+: Mix of everything - Tetriminos, letters, and symbols
Controls
Joystick: 8-direction movement
Joystick Button: Fire bullets
Button A: Toggle Auto-Fire
Button B: Toggle God Mode 
Scoring
Regular enemy: 10 points
Large enemy: 15 points
Boss hit: 5 points
Boss defeated: 100 points bonus
🚀 Quick Start
Hardware Requirements
M5StickC Plus2 
Mini JoyC Hat 

I built this from memory of the game 1942. Haven't played it in a while. This is the tetrimino space version.
author: Coreymillia

name: 1983 VECTREX Emulator For M5StickC Plus2 + 71 Games!
description:
A complete Vectrex emulator for the M5StickC Plus2 with Mini Joy C hat. Play all 71 classic Vectrex vector games on your handheld device with authentic green vector graphics!

GAMES LOAD SLOW!
I did not test them all. Some do not work. 
NOTE: The first thing you select will always send it back to the top of the menu. It will only do this once upon booting. I recommend just pressing M5 right when it loads. 
**Mini JoyC Hat Required!**

Key Features
✅ 71 Complete Vectrex ROMs embedded (625KB)
✅ Authentic Vector Graphics in classic green
✅ Full 4-Button Support - every Vectrex game compatible
✅ Mini Joy C Analog Control - precise 8-direction movement
✅ Scrolling ROM Menu - easy game selection
✅ Return to Menu Anytime - hold BtnB for 1 second
***Be patient! Game takes 1-2 min to load (this is normal)***
🕹️ Controls
ROM Selection Menu
JoyC Up/Down - Scroll through 71 games
M5- Select and start game
In-Game Controls
Button	Vectrex Function	Usage
JoyC Stick	Analog Joystick	8-direction movement
JoyC Button	Button 1	Primary fire/action (80% of games)
M5	Button 2	Thrust/jump/secondary fire (15% of games)
PWR	Button 3	Smart bomb/special (5% of games)
BtnB (short)	Button 4	Shield/select (rare)
BtnB (hold 1s)	System	Return to ROM menu
🎯 Game Collection (71 ROMs)
Classic Arcade Ports
Armor Attack
Berzerk 
Star Castle
Scramble
Pole Position
Rip-Off
Cosmic Chasm
Fortress of Narzod
Bedlam
Clean Sweep
Hyperchase
Space Wars
Spike
Spinball
Web Warp
Action & Shooters
Mine Storm ⭐ (Original pack-in game!)
Mine Storm II
Solar Quest
Star Hawk
Star Ship
Star Trek - The Motion Picture
Homebrew Classics
Gravitrex (John Dondzila)
Vector Vaders Remix
Patriots Series (3 versions)
Spike Series (4 versions)
Vectrexians
V-Frogger
All Good Things
Birds of Prey
Repulse
Star Fire Spirits
Star Seige
3D Games
3-D Mine Storm
3-D Crazy Coaster
3-D Narrow Escape
Puzzle & Strategy
Bedlam
Vectrex Maze
Labyrinth
Vectrex Pong
8Ball
Sports
Blitz! Action Football
Heads Up Action Soccer
Polar Rescue
Tour De France
...and 40+ more!

⚙️ Technical Specifications
Hardware
Device: M5StickC Plus2

📊 Performance
Expected Performance
ROM Loading: 1-2 minutes (BIOS initialization - normal)
Gameplay: 12-15 FPS typical
Menu: Instant response
Controls: Real-time, very responsive
Known Limitations
❌ Light pen games won't work (no hardware support)
⚠️ Initial load is slow (1-2 min per game)
⚠️ Frame rate lower than original (vector rendering intensive)
ℹ️ Runs at ~80% original speed (smoother feel)
Light Pen Games (5 ROMs - Non-functional)

Power on - you'll see ROM menu
Takes ~5 seconds to initialize
Pick a game with JoyC, press M5
Be patient! Game takes 1-2 min to load (this is normal)
Once loaded, enjoy smooth (some games are pretty slow) gameplay!
Best Games to Try First
Mine Storm - Classic asteroids-style shooter
Berzerk - Maze shooter
Star Castle - Strategic shooter
Armor Attack - Tank combat
Clean Sweep - Pac-Man style
Troubleshooting
Slow loading? Normal! Takes 1-2 min per game (enjoy the 1980s)
Buttons not working? Check game requirements (most use Button 1 only) NOTE* game controls can vary a LOT between games. 
Want to change game? Hold BtnB for 1 second
HOLD M5  to flip screen!

🏆 Credits
Development
Developer: Coreymillia
Based On
Original Emulator: ESP32_TinyVectrex
ROM Collection: Vectrex community (freeware/public domain)
Hardware: M5Stack ecosystem
Special Thanks
Vectrex community for preserving games
John Dondzila for amazing homebrew
M5Stack for great hardware

author: danil1251

name: 2 Player Tilt Pong! For BOTH M5StickC Plus1 & Plus2
description:
The original Pong was created in 1972 by Allan Alcorn, working for Atari Inc. It was released on November 29, 1972. And now you can play against your friends again today in 2025. Who needs flying cars?
*Requires 2 M5Sticks - Plus1 Plus2 OR one of each.
And a friend. 

To play.  
After burning the software to both devices. Start one up before the other! Or they won't sync. 

On the first device, It will boot to the calibrate screen. It says press A, actually press M5. Its just a typo I forgot to fix from programming.

Wait for it to look for a Host, after a few seconds of not finding a Host it will create one. When it says Host: Waiting start your second device.
It will then connect via WiFi as a Client.  

Then it starts fast! Tilt left to make paddle go UP tilt right to make paddle go DOWN. 

That's it! I only had one of each device when testing, so I have not tried to connect two of the same devices, but it should be universal. 
The sound does not turn off. My bad. But its not too loud.  

I know. I cannot take a good picture if my life depended on it.
Have fun with your blast from the past!

This is a 2 player tilt Pong created from the source code by freedomxxjustice 

Modified by Coreymillia

For BOTH M5StickC Plus1 & M5StickC Plus2! First multi device compatible, 2 player firmware I have made.  Seemed like a good place to start.

name: ATOM Blynk万能固件
description: 该固件可快速体验Blynk同时通过串口通讯让任意单片机接入Blynk，利用固件板载功能也可直接使用Blynk控制ATOM管脚电平状态与获取管脚电平变化，可轻松将传感器转化为物联网远程传感器或执行器，让物联网的使用变得更加简单，首次使用按住板载按钮不松开，单击复位按钮，指示灯出现红蓝交替闪烁时松开，设备自动开启热点ATOM_Blynk_XXXXXXXXX，密码XXXXXXXX，连接此热点访问IP地址192.168.4.1访问配置服务器与网络信息，确认无误后重启设备开始使用，设备与Blynk服务器断开连接，指示灯以100毫秒为周期持续闪烁，硬件串口与软串口波特率均为9600，其中软串口RX（26）TX（32），串口通过["PIN","value"]的json格式数据交互虚拟引脚数据，例如["V6","1"]表示虚拟引脚V6发送或接收到数据1，V0-V7已被ATOM占用，其他用途请用其他虚拟引脚，示例服务器地址为国内免费Blynk服务器地址仅供测试，稳定使用请私有部署服务器。温馨提示：第一次使用连接电脑打开串口监视器波特率为9600，查看调试信息

name: ATOM网络MP3播放器
description:
通过订阅MQTT主题收到网络MP3链接播放MP3，同时单击板载按钮可以对设置的主题发送一个名为atom的消息，使用需要通过M5Burner配置以下信息：
ssid  WiFi名称
pass  WiFi密码
broker  MQTT服务器地址
username  MQTT用户名
password  MQTT用户密码
port  MQTT开放端口
client_id  MQTT客户端ID（必须唯一）
topic  网络MP3订阅主题
button  ATOM板载按钮发送主题

低成本物联网服务器搭建交流qq群713809079
author: peien

name: ATOM网络按钮（自定义MQTT服务器）
description:
通过订阅MQTT主题改变板载指示灯颜色，同时单击,双击,长按开始,长按中与长按结束向指定主题分别发送1,2,3,4,5，使用需要通过M5BurnerNVS检查并配置以下信息：
ssid  WiFi名称
pass  WiFi密码
broker  MQTT服务器地址（默认为公共EMQX服务器地址
broker.emqx.io）
username  MQTT用户名（默认为空）
password  MQTT用户密码（默认为空）
port  MQTT开放端口（默认为1883）
client_id  MQTT客户端ID（必须唯一，若为空将自动设置为设备MAC地址）
topic  ATOM订阅主题（若为空则为订阅主题为IN_(MAC)）
button  ATOM板载按钮发送主题（若为空则为发布主题为OUT_(MAC)）

注意：ATOM板载指示灯颜色为16进制GRB模式如0x00ff00红色，0x0000f0蓝色，0xff0000绿色，其他以此类比。当WiFi名称与密码其中一个为空时指示灯将依次按红蓝绿顺序间隔500毫秒闪烁10次提示配置网络。按住板载按钮不松开单击复位按钮板载指示灯间隔100毫秒红黑闪烁20次后任然按住将清除WiFi信息重新配网

该应用可以将ATOM结合Nodered与homeasstant等工具用于家庭自动话
低成本物联网服务器搭建交流qq群713809079
不定期分享教程博客点击Github图标直达

name: Bitcoin Card Wallet
description:
Bitcoin Card Wallet allows you to generate seeds, addresses, and sign transactions. The seed is never stored on the device itself, and to sign a transaction, you must enter the seed words or use an RFID tag to store it.

- Manage Wallets: create seeds, public key, mnemonic words, balance

- Transaction Signing: Sign Bitcoin transactions directly on the device using your seed or RFID tag.

- Seed Storage on RFID Tags: Store your seed securely on an RFID MIFARE 1K tag (optionnal).

- Encrypted Seed Backup: Encrypt and store your seed on RFID tags for enhanced protection.

- Seed Restoration: restore your seed from RFID tags,or by manually entering mnemonic words.

- Transaction File Handling: Sign and export PSBT transaction files directly on the device.

- QR Code: Generate and display QR codes for easy sharing of Bitcoin and balance addresses.

- USB Typing: Emulate a USB keyboard to type out Bitcoin addresses.

- SD Card: Support for SD card storage to save and retrieve wallet data and saving PSBT file.

- Passphrase: Generate and use seeds with an optional passphrase for enhanced security.

name: Bruce+ Shark-Bait WiFi Defense For M5StickC Plus1
description:
Bruce firmware with Shark-Bait - WiFi Defence Firmware

Shark-Bait is a WiFi defense firmware for the M5StickC Plus, designd to detect and disrupt nearby threats in real time. It's built on the Bruce firmware foundation and inspired by the expressive security monitoring style of Evil Cardputer. The device scans for suspisious networks, visualizes threats with color-coded feedback, and deploys countermeasures like Karma and Evil Twin attacks. Pressing any button halts the operation instantly. 

This firmware blends practical mesh defense with expressive payload broadcasting. It's meant for ethical testing, educational use, and showcasing how compact hardware can respond to hostile environments with style. 

Some Bruce features removed to make everything fit. 
Untouched-
WiFi
Ble
Ir
FM
RF

Credit to Bruce firmware by @pr3y and team, and to Evil Cardputer for inspiring the monitoring philosophy. 

Only works on M5Stickc Plus ---  for now...

name: Bus Pirate - Cardputer & ADV
description:
A Hardware Hacking Tool with Web-Based CLI That Speaks Every Protocol.

If you are using the classic Cardputer, consider flashing it with the normal cardputer version for better default pin mapping (See Github).

It supports sniffing, sending, scripting, and interacting with various digital protocols (I2C, UART, 1-Wire, SPI, etc.) via a serial terminal or web-based CLI. It communicates with radio protocol as WiFi, BT, subghz, RFID, RF24.

name: COLUMNS - M5StickC Plus2 - Color Match 3 Game
description:
🎮 Game Features--- MINI JOYC HAT REQUIRED!
Core Gameplay
Classic Columns - Match 3+ gems in any direction
5 Colorblind-Friendly Colors with unique markers:
🔴 Red - Solid
🟡 Yellow - Solid
🔵 Blue - Solid
⚪ White - Black dot + X
🟢 Green - Black X
Ghost Piece - See exactly where pieces will land
400ms Lock Delay - Time to adjust placement (like Tetris)
All-Direction Matching - Horizontal, vertical, both diagonals
Chain Reactions - Gravity creates combos automatically
Progressive Difficulty - 3% faster each level
Advanced Features
Lock delay resets when moving left/right (smooth gameplay)
Ghost pieces have matching markers (white dot, white X)
Score multiplier for chain reactions (100 × chain number)
Level up every 1000 points
Maximum 20 levels, speeds from 500ms to 261ms
🕹️ Controls
Input--------------------Action
Joystick Left/Right	Move piece horizontally
Joystick Button	Cycle gem colors in column
Joystick Up	Cycle gems (alternative)
Joystick Down	Soft drop (faster falling)

 Tips
Use lock delay to slide pieces last-second
Watch ghost piece for perfect placement
Moving left/right extends lock delay timer
Set up diagonal matches for style points
Create cascades for massive chain combos

Scoring System
Basic Scoring
First match: 100 points
Second match (chain): 200 points
Third match (chain): 300 points
Formula: 100 × chain_number
Level Progression
Level up: Every 1000 points
Speed formula: 500ms × (0.97 ^ (level-1))
Max level: 20

I would have made it with more colors... but.. I am colorblind.
So. Its also colorblind friendly.  It is why there is an x on the green. There is a dot on the white because it was blinding and hard to tell apart from the yellow.  

 Credits
Developer: Coreymillia 
Inspired by: Sega Columns (1990)

author: Layer8

name: Cascade Battle - Single or Multi-Player Tetris *Gravity Mode* M5StickC Plus2
description:
Mini JoyC Hat required!
Both single and 2 player modes.
🕹️ CASCADE TETRIS BATTLE - M5StickC Plus2
Revolutionary CASCADE TETRIS with breakaway physics + 2-Player WiFi Battle Mode!
To connect hold down on the joyC on 1 Plus2. 
AFTER it creates a host hold down on the second Plus2. 
Ready up at the same time. Or one of you will be starting sooner.  

You do not HAVE to have a 2nd M5Stick Plus2 to play this game. But you do have to have a second one for multi player. And a friend who plays Tetris. 

🎮 Features
🌟  Gameplay
CASCADE PHYSICS: Watch pieces break apart and cascade when marked with X!
Toggle CASCADE Mode: Button B toggles breakaway physics ON/OFF for regular Tetris
Hold System: Hold pieces for strategic play (Pwr)
Ghost Piece Preview: See where you are about to land
Level Selection: Choose your difficulty (0-19)
Proper Wall Kicks: All pieces rotate consistently clockwise(only for T-Spins. I could not get wall kicks to work with the wall in this version)
Lock Delay System: Extra time to move pieces when they hit the ground
⚔️ 2-Player WiFi Battle
Real-time WiFi Battle: Two M5StickC Plus2 devices battle over WiFi
Attack System: Send garbage lines to opponent when clearing CASCADE lines
Danger Level: Visual indicator of incoming attacks
Ready-up System: Both players must ready up before battle starts
🎯 Controls 
Joystick: Move pieces (Left/Right/Down) + Rotate (Button)
Up - Hard drop
Down - Soft drop
Button A: Pause
Power Button: Hold
Button B: Toggle CASCADE breakaway mode ON/OFF
L+R Buttons: WiFi Beacon spam mode
Up on Joystick: WiFi Scanner mode
Down on Joystick: Battle Mode setup

Game Modes
CASCADE Mode (ON)
Pieces spawn with X markers randomly
X-marked blocks break apart when piece lands
Remaining blocks cascade down with physics
Creates chain reactions and complex gameplay
Regular Mode (OFF)
Standard Tetris gameplay
No breakaway physics
Traditional line clearing only
🛠️ Development Notes
Custom UDP protocol for real-time battle
Heartbeat system maintains connection
Attack data synchronized between devices
Button Fixes Applied
Swapped Button A and Power button functionality
Button B dedicated to CASCADE mode toggle

Revolutionary CASCADE physics system
2-Player WiFi battle implementation
M5StickC Plus2 optimization

This is probably my last version of Tetris... At least for this year.  It is pretty much the same as the other 2 player but with 7 extra pieces that cascade. All T-Spins, S-Spins, Z, J, L, and I spins should work. 
 
Next piece preview. Still only flashes real quick. Gives the game an extra challenge.

🏆 Credits
Original Firmware By
AleksAlcDel/Tetris-for-M5StickCPlus2 
Modified by Coreymillia

name: Chromatic Cascade - 22 Sound Reactive Effects! - Audio Spectrum Visualizer
description:
M5StickC Plus2 Ultimate Audio Spectrum Analyzer
The most comprehensive audio visualization suite for M5StickC Plus2 with 22 different visual modes ranging from classic spectrum analysis to psychedelic audio-reactive displays.

Ported and enhanced from the original M5StickC Plus1 version by KIRA Ryouta.

🎵 Features
Core Audio Analysis
Audio Spectrum Display - Real-time frequency analysis with 8 bands (125Hz to 16kHz)
Oscilloscope - Time domain waveform display with amplitude visualization
Tuner - Musical note detection with pitch accuracy and frequency display
🌈 Psychedelic Visual Modes (19 modes)
Audio Circles - Pulsating concentric circles that react to audio intensity
Audio Plasma - Classic plasma field effects synchronized to sound
Audio Fireworks - Explosive bursts triggered by frequency spikes
Audio Waves - Flowing wave patterns that dance with the beat
Audio Spiral - Rotating spiral patterns driven by audio energy
Water Ripples - Ripple effects that expand with sound intensity
Audio Plasma Field - Enhanced plasma with multi-color audio mapping
Audio Star Field - Twinkling stars that pulse with music
Fast Plasma - High-speed plasma effects for energetic tracks
Audio Rain - Digital rain drops falling to the rhythm
Exploding Fireworks - Large-scale firework displays
Lightning Storm - Electric bolts that strike with bass hits
Matrix Rain - Classic Matrix-style cascading code
Snow Effect - Gentle snowfall that intensifies with audio
Lava Lamp - Flowing blob effects synchronized to sound
Aurora Borealis - N. Lights simulation with audio colors(glitching)
Kaleidoscope - Symmetrical patterns that morph with frequency
Particle Tornado - Swirling particle effects
Sound Visualizer Bars - Enhanced spectrum bars with effects
🎛️ Controls
Button A: Cycle through all 22 modes sequentially
Button B: Toggle text display overlay on/off

🏆 Credits & Attribution
Original Concept: KIRA Ryouta (m5stickc-audiospectrum)
FFT Implementation: David Bird & macsbug
Pitch Detection: DyWaPitchTrack library team

Modified By Coreymillia

Efficiently Record and Share Time Records with M5StickC Plus2, Just Like a Stopwatch.
ChronoStamp is firmware that allows you to apply time recording to USB & WiFi sharing and external switches.
It records time as if you were using a stopwatch, and the data can be read and shared anytime via WiFi or USB.
It was developed as a high-performance time recording terminal to replace conventional stopwatches in practice sessions and small-scale competitions.

f = open('settings.toml', 'w')
f.write('CIRCUITPY_WIFI_SSID = "wifissid"\n')
f.write('CIRCUITPY_WIFI_PASSWORD = "wifipassword"\n')
f.write('CIRCUITPY_WEB_API_PASSWORD = "webpassword"\n')
f.close()

name: Clone your remote
description:
The app is intended to work with any generic IR receiver module for the Arduino. You don't even need to have it wired with GROVE connector. You can just wire it yourself with the jumper wires according to the module pinout. Attach signal pin to G1 pin of the GROVE port. And you need the SD card to be inserted into the Cardputer so the app could store commands from your remote.
============================
Supported IR protocols
All that IRRemote library supports
============================
Current features
Read signals from your remote. (All of that you read is stored in the array for the later send and limited to 42 entries).
Send signals that were read before.
Copy your remote to the SD card folder
Load copied remote from the SD card
Check Cardputer battery status
Settings (currently empty)

name: CoreS3 AIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ (顔検出)
description:
CoreS3の内蔵カメラで顔検出するAIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝです。
（robo8080さんのAIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝをベースとしています。）

・顔検出すると「御用でしょうか？」と音声認識を起動します。
・LCD左上隅にカメラ画像が表示されます。画像部分をタッチすると表示ON/OFFできます。
・画面中央左側をタッチするとサイレントモードになります。サイレントモード中に顔を検出すると、顔を追いかけるようにサーボ制御します。
・その他の機能はrobo8080さんのAIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝと同じです。

【動作条件】
タカオさんのPWMサーボ版シェルで動作確認済みです。
サーボはPort.Cに接続してください。

AIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝをベースにしているため、SDカードに次の情報を保存しておく必要があります。
・WIFIのSSIDとパスワード
・ChatGPTのAPIキー
・Google Cloud STTのAPIキー
・VoiceVoxのAPIキー
APIキーの取得方法など詳細はrobo8080さんのGithubを参照ください。
https://github.com/robo8080/AI_StackChan2_README/

音声合成にはVOICEVOX:ずんだもんを使用しています。

【お知らせ】
2024/7/10
ルート証明書を更新しました（「わかりません」しか言わなくなる問題の対策）

description:
This project is a little DRADIS simulator on M5Stack. Use cases ? None ! It's just for fun 😎 Note that this project works best with the M5GO/M5GO2/M5GO3 module (if you want to take advantage of the Cylon eye scanner...). Note that, if you're using an M5Stack with PSRAM memory (Fire, Core2, Core2 AWS, Core S3), you can activate a clock. Take a look to the documentation (https://github.com/armel/DRADIS/tree/main#clock-feature-only-on----).

Use left and right buttons to adjust brightness. Use the middle button to hear Cylon Eye Scanner and change theme (Grey, Blue, Sepia).

name: Drumputer  Antonio J. Lara
description:
Drumputer User Manual   https://youtu.be/KHAryvxbX6w
Drumputer is a drum machine and sequencer program for the M5Cardputer device. It allows you to create, edit, and play drum patterns with up to 4 instruments and 16 , 32 steps.
   Main Interface
- The grid shows 4 rows (instruments) and 16 or 32 columns (steps).
- Numbers on the left (1-4) represent instruments.
- Numbers on top represent steps (1-16 or 1-32).
- Filled squares indicate active steps for each instrument.
- The red cursor shows the current editing position.
- The green bar shows the current playing step.

Basic Controls
- Use ',' and '/' keys to move the cursor left and right.
- Press ENTER to toggle a step on/off.
- Use keys 1-4 to select an instrument.
- Press '0' to start/stop playback.
- Use the up or down keys to increase/decrease BPM.
- Press 'E' to toggle between 16 and 32-step mode.

## Special Playback Modes
- Press '5' for two-step roll mode (alternates between first two steps).
- Press '6' for reverse playback mode.

## File Management
- Press '9' to enter/exit the WAV file selection menu.
- In the WAV menu, use ',' and '/' to navigate, ENTER to select a file.
- Press '7' to enter/exit the sequence management menu.
- In the sequence menu:
  - Use 'S' to toggle between Save and Load modes.
  - Use 'D' to enter Delete mode.
  - Use ',' and '/' to navigate, ENTER to perform the selected action.

## Synchronization
- The device outputs a 2 PPQ (Pulses Per Quarter Note) sync signal on pin G2 y Gnd 
- This allows synchronization with other music equipment.
- The sync pulse is sent twice per beat, aligned with the sequencer's timing.
Tips
- In the WAV selection menu, you can preview sounds as you navigate.
- Saved sequences include BPM, step count, pattern, and sample assignments.
- The 32-step mode allows for more complex patterns.
- Use the roll and reverse modes for interesting rhythmic variations.
The wav files go in the root of the sd memory 
with any name but if you rename it this way 1.wav, 2.wav, 3.wav, 4.wav
 they will sound by default on each track without selecting anything

# Disclaimer

While the Drumputer has been successfully tested with equipment such as the Korg Pocket Operator and TD-3 without issues, the creator and developer of this software do not assume any responsibility for potential damages that may occur to your equipment when using this device.

The use of the Drumputer, including its synchronization features, is at the user's own risk. Users are advised to exercise caution and ensure compatibility with their specific equipment before connecting or using the Drumputer with other devices.

By using the Drumputer, you acknowledge that you understand and accept these terms, and agree to use the device responsibly and at your own discretion.
Drumputer was developed with the help of AI over the last month. While it has been successfully tested, it is still in development.
Known issue: Simultaneous playback of WAVs on a track may slow down the beat. Marketing and selling is not permitted

name: ESP Game Server
description:
****SD CARD NEEDED****
Project that transforms ESP32 and M5 Cardputer into a Classic Console Emulator Server, the user can take advantage of this feature via a browser on an Android and IOS smartphone, Computer, SmartTV or any device that has a modern browser.
Supported Games: PSX, SNES, N64, GBA, GB, Arcade, MAME, SMS, Genesis, Atari...
Visit the Github!


1. [EN] Download the "ESPGameServer" folder and SSIDEGS.txt via the link https://github.com/IncursioHack/ESP-Game-Server

   [PT-BR] Baixe a pasta "ESPGameServer" e o arquivo "SSIDEGS.txt" pelo link https://github.com/IncursioHack/ESP-Game-Server

2. [EN] Copy the "ESPGameServer" folder and the SSIDEGS.txt file to the root of your SD Card.

   [PT-BR] Copie a pasta "ESPGameServer" e o arquivo "SSIDEGS.txt" para a raiz do seu Cartão SD.

3. [EN] Change the content of the SSIDEGS.txt file and enter your wifi network data.

   [PT-BR] Altere o conteúdo do arquivo SSIDEGS.txt e insira os dados da sua rede wifi.
author: IncursioHack

Supported Games: PSX, SNES, N64, GBA, GB, Arcade, MAME, SMS, Genesis, Atari...
Visit the Github!


1. [EN] Download the "ESPGameServer" folder and SSIDEGS.txt via the link https://github.com/IncursioHack/ESP-Game-Server

   [PT-BR] Baixe a pasta "ESPGameServer" e o arquivo "SSIDEGS.txt" pelo link https://github.com/IncursioHack/ESP-Game-Server

2. [EN] Copy the "ESPGameServer" folder and the SSIDEGS.txt file to the root of your SD Card.

   [PT-BR] Copie a pasta "ESPGameServer" e o arquivo "SSIDEGS.txt" para a raiz do seu Cartão SD.

3. [EN] Change the content of the SSIDEGS.txt file and enter your wifi network data.

name: ESP32 Marauder for M5Stick C Plus (Screen works)
description:
The latest updated version of ESP32Maurauder with SD Card support and some much needed changes to the on-screen menu. More features work, but there are still a few things that aren't fully operational. I was able to get PCAPs stored to the SD Card for offline cracking, so that's a start.

You have to build your own SD Card adapter to plug into the M5Stick C Plus. To wire this up, you can get any generic Arduino/esp32 SPI MicroSD slot with 6 pins. 

StickCPlus Header - SPI SD Card Reader
             3v3   -   3v3
              GND   -   GND
               G0   -   CLK
          G36/G25   -   MISO
              G26   -   MOSI
                       
CS on the reader should be jumpered to GND

Known issues:
Recommend using external power. When the battery voltage drops, even a little, some brands of SD Cards stop working properly and could get corrupted.
No touch screen, so you can only use the "next" key (side button) and "select" key (M5 button on the front) to navigate

name: Evil Portal HUEBR for StickC Plus
description:
SDCard NOT required

This is a fork code do https://github.com/n0xa/

Moded BY: https://github.com/devotaviocc/ Moded BY: https://github.com/raphntc/

en-US

Hiding in plain sight, Wi-Fi honeypots are deceitful wireless networks masquerading as legitimate hotspots. They act like digital sirens, luring unsuspecting users with the promise of free internet access. But behind this facade lies a sinister reality: a trap designed to steal your data or infect your devices with malicious software. These honey traps, often deployed by hackers and cybercriminals, exploit the public's insatiable thirst for free Wi-Fi, turning our desire for connection into a vulnerability.

This is an Evil Portal developed for the M5STICK C PLUS

pt-BR

Escondidos à vista de todos, os honeypots Wi-Fi são redes sem fio enganosas que se disfarçam de hotspots legítimos. Eles agem como sirenes digitais, atraindo usuários desavisados com a promessa de acesso gratuito à Internet. Mas por trás dessa fachada existe uma realidade sinistra: uma armadilha projetada para roubar seus dados ou infectar seus dispositivos com software malicioso. Estas armadilhas, frequentemente utilizadas por hackers e cibercriminosos, exploram a sede insaciável do público por Wi-Fi gratuito, transformando o nosso desejo de ligação numa vulnerabilidade.

Este é um Portal Evil desenvolvido para o M5STICK PLUS!

Para vizualizar as credenciais acesse: https://172.0.0.1/creds (Lembrando que precisa estar conectado na rede :v)
author: raphntc

name: Evil Portal Hater - 420 Seafood Roast - Bruce+ Nemo- 2,025 Jokes/Insults Clock
description:
PortalHater Core v2025
Two Modes:
-The Ultimate Evil Portal Defense System for M5Stack CORE
-PLUS! a STAND ALONE desk clock with 2,025 randomly shuffled Jokes/insults

420 tech roast insults for data theives.

PortalHater Core is a powerful ESP32-based tool designed to detect and attack evil portals (captive portal WiFi attacks) used by devices like Flipper Zero, WiFi Pineapple, and other penetration testing tools. Built for the M5Stack CORE, it features an intuitive menu system, customizable display colors, and 2,025 jokes/insults to keep you entertained.

🎯 Features
Portal Attack Modes
Bruce Attack Mode: Sends spam packets to overwhelm WiFi Pineapple portals
Nemo Attack Mode: Targets Flipper Zero evil portals with packet flooding
Dual Attack: Can target both portal types simultaneously
Real-time Display: Shows attack messages with animated sine wave graphics
Entertainment Modes
2025 Jokes/Insults: Random rotating collection of:
Tech snark
90s playground insults
Food-based roasts
Device failure messages
AI overlord contempt
Historical/literary comparisons
Abstract conceptual insults
And much more!
Auto-scroll: Adjustable from 2 seconds to 1 minute per joke
Manual Navigation: Skip jokes with button press
Customization
Clock Display: Time starts at 7:10 24hour format.
Do not unplug or you will have to reset clock. And I could have made setting it a little easier. But it is not difficult. 
Real-time clock on main screen, attack, and during joke scrolling
Color Customization:
Clock color (12 preset colors)
Joke text color (12 preset colors)
Insult text color for portal attacks (12 preset colors)
Brightness Control: 16 levels from dim to maximum
Visual Effects: Animated sine wave borders with randomized patterns
🎮 Controls
Button Layout (M5Stack CORE)
Button A (Left): Scroll up in menus / Adjust scroll time in Jokes mode / Toggle Portal Hater from main screen (you have to wait for it to stop attacking to exit back to main screen!)
Button B (Middle): Enter menu / Select menu item / Exit current mode
Button C (Right): Scroll down in menus / Skip to next joke / Adjust scroll time in Jokes mode
Menu Navigation
Portal Hater Mode: Activate WiFi attack mode
Jokes Mode: Display random jokes/insults
Set Clock: Set current time (24-hour format)
Clock Color: Choose clock text color
Joke Color: Choose joke text color
Insult Color: Choose portal attack message color
Brightness: Adjust screen brightness (16 levels)

Customizable Options
All settings are adjustable via the menu system and persist between uses:

Clock time (24-hour format)
Text colors for clock, jokes, and insults
Auto-scroll timing (2-60 seconds)
Screen brightness (1-16)

⚠️ Legal Disclaimer
This tool is for educational and defensive purposes only.

PortalHater Core is designed to:

Demonstrate WiFi security vulnerabilities
Defend against captive portal attacks
Insult yourself or friends
Test network security in controlled environments
You must:

Only use this tool on networks you own or have explicit permission to test
Comply with local laws and regulations regarding WiFi security testing
Not use this tool for malicious purposes or unauthorized access
The developers are not responsible for any misuse of this software.

🐛 Known Issues
Clock must be manually set each time (no RTC battery backup) and setting the clock kind of sucks, I knew about it and was done with this for now. 
Battery life is ~10 minutes when actively attacking (normal for M5Stack CORE)
The graphics freeze up in the attack mode. I did not try to fix. 

Tested with Bruce and Nemo. NOT tested with a flipper zero. 

Truth is I really wanted a scrolling insult desk clock.  A lot of the jokes are stupid but some are pretty funny. You don't ever have to turn the Portal Hater on. 

All jokes and insults generated by asking multiple AI agents what they would say to people if they could. Particularly one question asking Gemini to make some jokes about if it was an AI overlord. Pretty sure that chatbot does not like people.  With that being said there is nothing as offensive as it probably could have been.  

Created by Coreymillia
author: Coreymillia

name: Evil Portal Hater - Bruce + Nemo - 420 Seafood Roast - Watch/Clock
description:

Portal Killer Watch is a discrete defense tool disguised as a simple watch. When activated, it automatically detects and attacks evil WiFi portals by flooding their credential capture systems with garbage data and savage insults.

Core Functionality

Connects and floods them with fake credentials
Uses different savage insults for each request
Tracks kill count on screen
Smart Gateway Detection (v1.1.3)
Auto-detects portal IP - works with any gateway
Supports 192.168.4.1 (WiFi Pineapple)
Supports 172.0.0.1 (NEMO, Bruce)
Supports custom gateway IPs
Dual Attack Strategy (v1.1.3)
Generic Portal Attack:

Endpoints: /login, /auth, /signin, /portal, /admin
Format: username=hacker&password=<insult>&email=trash@dump.com
NEMO/Bruce Portal Attack:

Endpoint: /post (hit multiple times)
Format: email=trash@garbage.com&password=<insult>
Attack Pattern
3 attack rounds per portal
8 endpoints per round (5 generic + 3 NEMO)
24 total POST requests with garbage data
Different random insult for each request
Portal logs flooded with trash! 🗑️
Clock & Display
8 clock colors - Red, Orange, Green, Cyan, Blue, Magenta, Yellow, White
11 brightness levels - 25 to 255
24-hour format - Configurable (default: enabled)
Time setting - Adjustable hours and minutes
Portal status - Shows active scanning, kill count
Power Management
Screen Timeout
5 duration options - 10s, 30s, 60s, 120s, 300s
Toggle ON/OFF - PWR button
Saves last used settings
Portal Killer continues running when screen is off
Shake to Wake
3 sensitivity levels - Light, Medium, Heavy
Toggle ON/OFF - PWR button
Wake screen by shaking the watch
Configurable acceleration thresholds
Settings Persistence (v1.1.0)
All settings survive reboot:

✅ Clock color
✅ Brightness level
✅ Screen timeout (state + duration)
✅ Shake to wake (state + sensitivity)
✅ 24-hour format preference
Uses ESP32 NVS (Non-Volatile Storage) - settings stored in flash memory.

💬 The Insults
420 roasts targeting data thieves and portal hackers

🎯 Targets
Tested & Verified
Portal Type	Status	Gateway IP	Attack Format
WiFi Pineapple	✅	192.168.4.1	Generic
NEMO Portal	✅	172.0.0.1	NEMO-specific
Bruce Portal	✅	172.0.0.1	NEMO-specific
Generic Evil Portals	✅	Various	Generic
Custom Captive Portals	✅	Auto-detected	Dual attack

🔒 Legal & Ethics
Intended Use
This tool is designed for:

Security research - Testing your own networks
Educational purposes - Understanding captive portals
Authorized penetration testing - With proper permissions
Personal protection - Defending against rogue portals
Important Notes

name: Evil Portal... Killer - M5StickC Plus2
description:
During testing of this I was able to crash the Evil Portal. Sends spam every 500ms. 50 packs at a time.  During all of the test, Evil Portal would crash in between 2-300 spam messages. Checking with my phone it was gone, error message, until the Evil device was restarted. 

This was supposed to have a lot more features. But things did not go as planned. So we focused on the Portal Killer function. Finds any Evil portal regardless of name.  I do not know if it will work with a custom HTML, yet.  When you boot up R button navigates up. There is no down. M5 to select. 
The screen does still say A, B and C. I probably could have fixed this easily. But... Well just letting you know. There is no C. 

There are 3 choices
-Scan for Threats-
-Counter Attack- This is the Portal Killer
-Shield Mode- This was taken from Bruce somewhere it was working... now it seems to do something.... but probably not much.
To return to menu press R

The project may get updated some day. We had a lot of features but most were less than useful. As it is it's pretty cool, and stable. You may have to rescan if the portal goes offline and back on. You shouldn't but I don't think I got that working again.

 The original goal, was to spam thousands of messages, and it was. But at some point it started crashing the portal, pretty fast. So that seemed even better. No guarantee it will. 

Created by Coreymillia with code that may or may not be yours. I no longer know. But there is at least a little bit of team Bruce left in there I am sure. If not it was what we used for testing.
author: Coreymillia

name: Evil Social Parasite - Portal Killer M5StickC Plus1 & Plus2! Unified
description:
This is a social parasite. For both the M5StickC Plus1 AND Plus2 unified project! 

To use. 
-It has 2 functions. How you power it on, or how they meet will affect how it works. 
-If you want the parasites to chat. Power them on together. They will discover each other and start to spin around and chat in their own language of 139 words in random generated messages. 
-If you want them to attack a known Evil Portal then  you will want to power them on ONE at at time and wait for them to connect to the portal. You will know when they are attacking. 
-I got 3 to connect to one portal, each one spamming at one message @500ms per message. This caused an Evil Portal I was running to CRASH. Fast. 
-You have to restart the device to return to normal scan mode. If you are just running one hoping to run into a stranger or Evil Portal.  It will scan for both. 
-I was unable to get the tilt reaction from the original project to work... yet. 
----This was created from the Evil Parasite project by 7h30th3r0n3----

Modified by Coreymillia
author: Coreymillia

name: Evil-AtomS3
description:
Warning : SDcard is nedded ! Evil-AtomS3 is an innovative tool developed for ethical testing and exploration of WiFi networks. It harnesses the power of the M5Core2 device to scan, monitor, and interact with WiFi networks in a controlled environment. This project is designed for educational purposes, aiding in understanding network security and vulnerabilities. I recommend using arduino compilation to change passwords otherwise you will have default passwords.

Features:
- WiFi Network Scanning: Identify and display nearby WiFi networks.
- Network Cloning: Check information and replicate networks for in-depth analysis.
- Captive Portal Management: Create and operate a captive portal to prompt users with a page upon connection.
- Credential Handling: Capture and manage portal credentials.
- Remote Web Server: Monitor the device remotely via a simple web interface that can provide credentials and upload portal that store file on SD card.
- Sniffing probes: Sniff and store on SD near probes.
- Karma Attack: Try a simple Karma Attack on a captured probe.
- Automated Karma Attack: Try Karma Attack on near probe automatically.
- Wardriving: Wardriving with Wigle format output on SD.
- Beacon Spam: Generate mutliple SSIDs arround you.
- Deauth detect: deauthentification and pwnagotchi detection

name: GPS Logger
description:
WORKS WITH ALL UART GPS MODULES (M5, Grove...)

It reads GPS data, displays it on the screen, and saves the data to an SD card. The device operates in two modes: NORMAL mode and SLEEP mode.

- NORMAL: Displays the GPS data on the screen every 3 seconds while saving the GPS data to the SD card every minute (can be turned off).

- SLEEP: Saves the GPS data to the SD card every minute before entering light sleep mode. The Cardputer's screen is turned off, and it appears to be OFF.

* USAGE *

- You will need a UART GPS module connected to the M5Cardputer and an inserted SD card. This has been tested with the M5 GPS module and the Grove GPS module

- Select NORMAL or SLEEP mode

- The GPS data will be saved in the file gps_data.csv at the root of the SD card.

* CONTROLS : 

For NORMAL mode
       - OK Toggles SD card on/off.
       - S Toggles screen on/off.
       - + and - Adjusts brightness.

name: Gameboy Enhanced Firmware
description:
Cardputer & Adv; New faster cpu emulation core('fastest' mode in cpu settings, the default unless I get incompatibilty reports). Cycle available scales using the \ button. Change vertical scale & alignment using Fn+\ Check back often for latest updates.

Gameboy Emulator; complete with configurable controls, audio, display and performance options, savegames, save states, filesystem navigation and no .gb rom file size limits imposed by memory. Various other enhancements. Accurate palettes. Partial Super Gameboy Enhancement support, including borders. Extended 12 colour mode, along with all official/original GBC palettes. 44 Analogue Pocket 12 colour community palettes included with automatic mapping of titles to AP palettes partially implemented. Pokemon Silver/Gold,  Dragon Warrior I&II and Azure dreams are the only confirmed fully supported .gbc titles, backwards compatible with the original gameboy and run in that mode. Emulator will behave as if you placed a gameboy colour cartridge into an original gameboy in most instances. Feel free to try other backwards compatible gbc games, but no garuntees on compatiblity. All *.gb and *.gbc files are listed by the file explorer in the current directory.

Read the instructions at the bottom for controls. Forked from original gb_cardputer implementation. As of version 0.75 a launcher is no longer required, versions prior to that have no bootloader merged so if you are having issues try using m5launcher to install.

Save states can be used by pressing the minus/underscore key to load,  and backspace/del to save.

Hold Fn and press the left arrow to mute audio
Hold Fn and press the right arrow to jump to 50/100% volume
Hold Fn and press the up/down arrows to change volume in smaller adjustments.

* Audio rendering has been made faster updating every 24 by default samples, was twelve; 24 will be the default (a.k.a. medium quality) sligt reduction in quality when frame rate dips low can be noticed at 36; may make option for audio quality. Updating every 36 samples seems
to be the minimum(clicking becomes more likely beyond this update interval), so 12,24,36 seem to be appropriate settings; every 12 sameples was used in 6.0 may added higher and lower quality settings in future
* Adjusted TTL logic to run seperately from the page retrieval so that retrieving data is as fast as possible when in memory.
29.05.2024:v0.61
* Memory solution devised was based on two ideas: Assume stastically random access patterns, and place no limits on addressable space.
The reality is that the gameboy games never exceed 8megabits (1megabyte); Taking advantage of the limitations of the gameboy, I have removed the generalized nature of the	previous solution in favor of one that provides a deterministic approach to page seeking, with the tradeoff that no games larger than a real game boy game can be loaded any longer. This should not pose an issue for any (valid) title. This has increased frame rates slightly all around and made them much steadier; page location has no bearing on access times. Page seek times are fixed, and a minor amount of page maintenance is done at these intervals, distributed across successive calls still. This would be deterministic page seeking mixed with the previous progressive pruning.
* Added Error messages with regards to writing save game files, attempts to do so when there is no cart ram
* Added Error messages specific to the case of being unable to open a file vs. file size 0 (was ambiguous before)
* Removed pause associated with automatic savegames; bars operate on a timer now and will disappear 1second after pending write is completed

Further Note: I put no limits on control configuration. Make everything a single button if you want.

* Added SGB border for Pokemon Red
* Added SGB border for Links Awakening
* Added notification for titles with Analogue Pocket profile, but no SGB profile
* Work on audio playback engine has begun, core 0 continusoly feeds audio from a buffer to the speaker; a test 1000hz sine wave shows little to no stuttering while emulator runs, needs tuning. Disabled until apu work complete.
23.05.2024:v0.53
* Required memory for pokemon +5k just incase has been made available
* Implemented 12-color Analogue Pocket palettes for Pokemon Red/Blue
* Implemented preset SGB and GBC palettes for Pokemon Red/Blue
* Implemented SGB borders for Pokemon Blue
* disabled audio for this release; exported to wav file to examine and while its the same code
it is not generating the same output as the PC test version. Will take further research.
22.05.2025:v0.52
* Implemented audio with peanut_gb hooks on PC (version for debugging); verified APU core and waveforms
* Integrated Audio with peanut_gb hooks on ESP32; audio waveforms are now being generated, needs balancing with CPU and speaker playback still

21.05.2024:v0.51
* implemented main emulator function as a task on core 1 and a second persistent task on core 0 via RTOS; this is in preparation to acommodate the APU engine
* core 0 thread must call vTaskDelay as there are vital threads on that core, which if not attented to, will cause a restart. I dont have full use of this core.
* discovered pokemon starts working if I have more free memory so I suspect I run out of stack space. 180k paging it works 200 it doesn't will calculate requied amount

20.05.2024:v0.5
* added bottom menu bar with instructions to the main rom selection menu, pres ESC or ' key (same thing) to enter the settings menu either from the main menu or while playing a game
* added options menu, can be entered from the menu or from within a game; displays the 8 main controls with their current setting, saves settings when closed
* added restore defaults for config menu
* settings are saved to gbconfig.dat; delete this if you are having any issues

19.05.2024:v0.492
* Reimplemented memory subsystem to use progressive partial page seeking/pruning; the original memory management code was the first I had typed in 14 years; after some thought I devised something much more suitable for a real time environment. This resulted in the average page seek time being much lower, and distributes maintenance of the paging system across successive calls. The results are the largest improvement to speed to date. Over double the frame rates from before; less stutter, smoother page transitions in memory. Donkey Kong Land averages around 45fps now; Super Mario land 2 gets an average 53fps on the overworld.

18.05.2024:v0.491
* Reduced rendering workload 6.25% by modifying peanut_gb to inherently skip lines that aren't visible due to scaling.
This prevents the engine from having to process the layer and sprite data for these lines all together. Why 6.25%? because 9 lines are skipped which is 6.25% of the lines that were rendered previously.

17.05.2024:v0.49 
* Refactored graphics code; ~120,000 less operations a frame
* Scrolling behaviour and screen content differences no longer effect rendering performance Titles such as final fantasy or even super mario land 2 show a huge improvement in overworld movement speed.

17.05.2024: v0.483 Pushing this now as a BUG FIX RELEASE
* Fixed bug in main menu causing selection to only move upward; you can now navigate properly again.
* added FPS display while Fn button is held, causes slow down which is subtracted from the FPS display. This is so I can evaluate performance improvements more than anything else, but it doesn't hurt to have so I'm leaving it in.
* new borders are on hold while I make decisions about the internal format (leaning towards argb1555,presently 565)
16.05.2024: v0.482
* Added Analogue Pocket 12color palette category with 44 palettes
* Automatic 12color(AP) palettes mapped as per Analogue Pocket suggested mappings for:
	Mario 1/2/Wario Land/Balloon Kid/F1 Race/Tetris
* added Cottage Daytime SGB border
* Fixed 12colours not being assigned until palette select bug
* regularly mapped controller up/down/a now functions in addition to arrow/enter keys in main menu to allow a single hand posture for the entire interface if desired.

15.05.2024: v0.481
* proper DMG-01 startup sequence, may help compatibility with some games.
* Message boxes now will display any emulation errors reported by peanut_gb
* Attempts to access ROM address outside of the available cartridge ROM will display an appropriate message

14.05.2024 v0.48 Added 12 colour mode, with the 12 palettes the game boy colour could apply to old game boy games as the first of this mode, but more to come in this area.
*Super gameboy support added for screen borders with gameboy skin set as default, followed by 1 (for now) of the official borders from the hardware itself. Activate by holding Fn and pressing '[' and cycle borders by holding Fn and pressing ']'. Because these are the same keys used for other visual modifications, I hope using the combination of Fn and these keys is intuitive.
* Super gameboy palette support added for balloon kid, the legend of zelda links awakening and kirbys pinball land
* Various other small tweaks you probably wont notice.

12.06.2025 V0.47 Added first iteration of Super Gameboy Mode with all 32 official palettes that were included with the original hardware. Nintendo included a table on the device to map certain games to certain palettes, and that functionality is partially implemented. Mario 1/2/Wario Land, F1 Racer and Tetris all autodetect and assign their colour scheme. This mode can be toggled on and off at any time during play with the '[' button, and the current cycle palette button will cycle through the 32 included palettes. Games with defined profiles with start with that palette selected automatically when Super Gameboy Mode is engaged for the first time each session. 
*Lots of user interface changes; message boxes will appear to describe your palette selections, among other things - no console style debug remains in normal operation.
*Another 4k of memory allocated to ROM storage, may smooth out some edge cases of stuttering.
*Improved readability in the main menu; and made highlighted selection more apparent.
*Added smooth transitions to splash screen.
*Disabled unused (for the moment) configuration file

11,05.2024:: 0.44 squished a bug, added palette control, press ']' to cycle between presets.
b/w, gameboy(original), gameboy pocket and gameboy light (in that order).
Huge performance improvements for larger ROMs with over 110k more ram available to the memory sub-system. Palette values are from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_video_game_console_palettes for accuracy.

10.05.2024:: 0.41 added savegame support. if a game uses it's onboard ram constantly though, use the manual backup button (=). The save feature will only automatically engage after the cartridge ram has been left untouched for a second.

Yellow bars on either side of the display momentarily indicate that the cartridge ram has been backed up. The savegame format will not be changing, its a simple binary dump.

Controls(in game):
left/right use 'a' and 'd'
up/down use 'e' and 's'
A/B use 'l' and 'k'
start/select use '1' and '0'
cycle palette in current mode use the ] square bracket
cycle between classic gameboy,super gameboy & 12 color modes [
quicksave/savestate press del/backspace key
quickload/loadstate press minus/underscore key
force cart ram backup  press '=' (if uncertain of gamesave use this)
turn on super gameboy border at any time by pressing Fn+'['
cycle through border options by pressing Fn+']'
Display current FPS by holding Fn; it will appear in 1 second and update every second there after, can cause some slowdown but that is accounted for in the FPS count.
Press `/esc in the main menu or during gameplay for settings menu
Mute audio using Fn+left arrow
Raise audio to 50% then 100% using Fn+right arrow
Change volume using Fn+up/down arrow keys for granular control

Have fun!

name: Guinomo API StickCPlus2
description:
This firmware for the M5StickC Plus 2 turns it into a compact REST API server for real-time sensor data. It reads accelerometer, gyroscope, temperature, battery, and button states, showing them on the device screen. It supports WiFi client mode and AP configuration mode.

Quick Setup:

Power on the device; if no WiFi is saved, it starts in AP mode.

Connect to the AP GuinomoAPI-Config (password: guinomoadmin).

Open http://192.168.4.1/setup in a browser.

Enter your WiFi SSID and password, then click Save and Connect.

Device restarts and connects automatically.

Access endpoints like /api/sensors, /api/gyro, /api/accel, and /api/buttons to get JSON data. Ideal for IoT experiments, prototyping, or building sensor-based applications. Configuration is saved persistently for quick reconnection after restarts. Lightweight, efficient, and fully interactive, made by a Brazilian <3.

name: Hector I2S Mic Audio Upgrade
description:
This was taken from the Hector project by tobozo 

Upgrade for Hector
10 Wave patterns (middle button)
4 Display styles (left button)
Change speed (right button)

Will run without microphone, you can adjust speed by pressing R button. 

HOLD R button to toggle audio only mode. 
**To use audio only mode you have to connect an I2S microphone**
Mic______________Core
SD(data) -- -------26
WS(word sel) -----16
SCK(clock)---------17
VDO(power)--------3v
Gnd----------------G
LR---------------G 

Original audio and banner disabled. based on. Not exactly the same as I do not know if I found the right repo... but its not bad, more colorful. not quite as smooth as I wanted it. It is pretty cool without the mic but adding an I2S mic was so easy with the core! Gives it a kick!

name: Infiltra 0.8 Release (Cardputer)
description:
🎉INFILTRA FIRMWARE 0.8 IS HERE! 🎉
⚙️ Flash now at infiltra.xyz

💻 Source code available on GitHub — check the #github channel!
🧠** What’s New in v0.8**
Functions:
-🖥️ Monitor PC, 🔐 Creds Page, 💬 InfiChat, 📡 Added IR Database (IR apps + extended IR codes),
-📶 NRF Reader (Beta), 🔍 Find SubGhz FQ, 🌐 Infinode Connect (Beta), 🔋 Battery Saver,
-💡 Brightness Slider, ⚙️ Pin Configurations, ⏰ Time support added.
💻 Code Changes
-📁 Board.json files for better stability and easier open-source editing.
-🧮 Improved IR Sending Protocols — optimized for hex-based precision.
-💾 Optimized storage usage — less space used on devices and smoother performance.
⚙️ Stability Improvements
-🔋 Longer battery life
-🚫 No random restarts
-⚡ Faster screen transitions + animations
-📶 Quicker WiFi/BLE scanning (Recon)
-🔦 Faster IR emitting times
🧰 Added Devices
-🧪 Wio Terminal (BETA)
-🔜 Tembed models (coming 2 days after 0.8 due to constraints)
💬 Got ideas for the next update?
We’re taking feedback for v0.9 — share your thoughts and feature requests in the feedback channel! 💡

💖 Thank you all for your incredible support and patience!
Every test, bug report, and suggestion pushes Infiltra forward.
This community is the reason we keep improving — and 0.9 will be even bigger! 🚀

✨ Flash now: infiltra.xyz

🧠 GitHub: check #github for the full source and changelog
author: D3CRYPT.

name: JousTris - Atari Joust Remake - Tetrimino Game *M5StickC Plus2
description:
*Requires Mini JoyC Hat*
🎮 JousTris
Classic Joust Meets Tetris on M5StickC Plus2!

Fly on S and Z tetromino pieces as birds in this arcade-style aerial combat game. Battle enemies, collect eggs before they hatch, and survive endless waves of increasing difficulty!

✨ Features
Core Gameplay
🐦 Classic Joust Physics - Gravity-based flight with flap mechanics
🎨 Tetromino Birds - S and Z pieces that flip based on direction
⚔️ Height-Based Combat - Higher position wins collisions
🥚 Egg System - Defeated enemies drop eggs that hatch if not collected
🦖 Pterodactyl Hazard - Anti-camping punishment for stalling
🔥 Lava Bottom - Deadly hazard at screen bottom
🌀 Screen Wrapping - Seamless left/right edge wrapping
Advanced Systems
🧠 Smart AI - Limited hunters (1-3) actively chase you, others wander
🏔️ Procedural Platforms - Fresh layout every wave
📈 Endless Progression - Difficulty scales infinitely
💾 Safe Respawn - Smart spawn checking with invulnerability
🎯 God Mode - Invincible testing/practice mode
🚀 Auto-Flap - Continuous flapping accessibility option
🛠️ Hardware Requirements
Required
M5StickC Plus2 
Mini JoyC Hat 

🕹️ Controls
JoyC Mini Hat
Joystick Left/Right - Fly horizontally
JoyC Button - Flap wings (tap or hold)
M5StickC Plus2 Buttons
Button A (M5) - Toggle Auto-Flap mode
Button B (Side) - Toggle God Mode
Control Modes
Normal Mode - Tap button to flap (classic arcade)
Auto-Flap Mode - Hold button for continuous flapping (4 flaps/sec)
God Mode - Invincible, instant kills from any angle
🎮 Gameplay
Objective
Survive endless waves by defeating enemy birds and collecting eggs before they hatch into stronger enemies.

Combat Rules
Higher Y position wins - Attack from above!
Same height - Bounce apart
Lower position - You lose a life
God Mode - Win from any angle
Enemies
Hunters (1-3 per wave) - Actively chase you
Wanderers - Patrol randomly across the board
Pterodactyls - Spawn if you stall, must hit head to kill
Scoring
Defeat enemy: 50 points
Collect egg: +points
Defeat pterodactyl: 100 points
Wave Progression
Wave	Enemies	Hunters	AI Speed	Egg Hatch	Pterodactyl Timer
1-2	-------------4-------1------1.0x------6 sec-----------30 sec
3-8	----5-7---------2------------------1.4-2.0x----4-3 sec---27-22 sec
9+--------8---------3------------2.2x+-------2 sec--------20-15 sec

Enemy AI States
Wander - Random horizontal movement
Chase - Pursue player horizontally, try to get above
Flee - Move away from player
Hunter Assignment
Wave 1-2: 1 hunter, rest wander
Wave 3-8: 2 hunters, rest wander
Wave 9+: 3 hunters (max), rest wander
Dead hunters are replaced automatically
Egg Mechanics
Drop when enemy defeated
Fall with gravity, land on platforms
Hatch timer: 6s (Wave 1) → 2s (Wave 10+)
Flash red in last 1.5 seconds
Hatch into stronger enemies if not collected
Pterodactyl
Spawn Trigger:
Wave takes >30s (decreases to 15s by Wave 15)
Player idle with eggs >15s (decreases to 8s)
Behavior: Homes in on player position
Speed: 3.0 → 5.0 (increases with wave)
Kill Method: Must hit tiny red head hitbox (precision)
God Mode: Instant kill from any angle
Respawn System
Death: 0.8 second delay
Spawn Check: Finds safe location away from enemies/eggs
Invulnerability: 2 seconds (flashing sprite)
Lives: Start with 3, game over at 0

👏 Credits
Game Design & Development: Coreymillia
Inspired by: Joust (Williams Electronics, 1982)

name: LucidWatch - Lucid Dream Training Watch or Clock *M5StickC Plus2*
description:
Is your life feeling dull and dingy? Try lucid dreaming!
I started to learn lucid dreaming over 25 years ago. I have included everything I could to help you get started with this watch. Question reality at all times, you will eventually question it in a dream. 

Check out my Github for free PDF books on lucid dreaming or search Archive for many free resources. If you are really serious about the most profound thing you may ever experience. 

HOLD B to enter menu. 
Press B to select option.
Press M5 to change value (B decreases)
Press Pwr to save and exit to clock. 
LucidWatch v2.0 - Ultimate Lucid Dream Training Watch
The most advanced lucid dream training device for M5StickC Plus2!

🌙 What is LucidWatch?
LucidWatch is a comprehensive lucid dream training tool that combines:

9 Different Reality Check Types
Night Mode with REM Targeting - Gentle audio cues during REM sleep
Morning Dream Journal Alarm - Reminds you to record dreams
Interactive Reality Tests - Light switch test accessible anytime

🎯 Key Features
Reality Check System
8-20 random alarms per day
9 different RC types
Auto-dismiss after 10 seconds
Quiet hours for sleep
Night Mode (REM Cue System)
Hold Button A to activate before sleep
Waits 4.5 hours through deep sleep
Gentle beeps during REM windows
Train your brain to achieve lucidity!
Morning Dream Journal
Gentle wake-up alarm
"What did I dream last night?"
Critical for dream recall
Interactive Tests
Button A: Instant Light Switch Test
Toggle WHITE ↔ BLACK screen
In dreams, brightness fails!
🎮 Controls
Button A (press): Light Switch Test
Button A (hold 1s): Night Mode
Button B (hold 2s): Menu
PWR: Exit any mode
🏆 The Complete Workflow
DAY: Random RC alarms → Build awareness habit NIGHT: Night Mode → REM cues → Lucidity triggers MORNING: Journal alarm → Record dreams → Improve recall

📝 The 9 Reality Checks
Finger Through Palm
Text Stability
Nose Breathing
Watch Time (Live Clock)
Mirror Test
Physics Test
Light Switch
Hand Count
Memory Recall
Dream big! 🌙✨

Note the battery of the M5Stick is short. Recommended settings for a longer life, turn brightness down. Enable button wake only. Keep screen timeout low. Also includes an always on option if you want to use it as a clock plugged in. 

Note: Night mode triggers a beeping while you are sleeping during anticipated REM. You may want to read about it before trying it out. 

Created by Coreymillia and GOOD LUCK LUCID DREAMING!

name: M5 Atom Matrix - Companion v4 - Satellite Surface
description:
M5 Atom Matrix Companion v4 Satellite

A single-button control surface for Companion v4 using the M5 Atom Matrix. Includes 5x5 LED-matrix icons for boot, WiFi setup, waiting state and ready state. Supports external RGB LED output on G33 (Red), G22 (Green), G19 (Blue) with G23 as ground. LED colour mirrors the Companion key colour.

Features include WiFi configuration portal (hold button for 5 seconds), OTA firmware updates, automatic deviceID based on full MAC address, and full Companion v4 API support including KEY-STATE, COLOR, BRIGHTNESS and PING handling.

Ideal for tally indicators, stage triggers, simple control surfaces and event automation tools. Stable codebase aligned with the AtomS3 and AtomS3R versions so all satellites behave consistently.

Default OTA password: companion-satellite
author: themusicnerd

name: M5 Atom S3 - Companion v4 - Satellite Surface
description:
A compact, single-button satellite surface built for Companion v4 using the M5 AtomS3. Supports external RGB rear LED, full-screen bitmap mode, and a new high-visibility text mode with extra-large fonts for simple labels. Includes WiFi config portal, OTA updates, and automatic MAC-based device ID. Perfect for on-stage triggers, tally, timers, and status displays.

Features

Uses the M5 AtomS3 (ESP32-S3 / 0.85″ 128×128 display)

Two selectable display modes:
• Bitmap mode – full-screen rendering of Companion’s 72×72 bitmaps (upscaled)
• Text mode – fast, low-latency text with COLOR/TEXTCOLOR support

Extra-big font for 1–2 characters

Ultra-large font for 3 characters

Large font for 4–6 characters

Multi-line auto-wrapped text for longer labels

External RGB LED on G8/G5/G6 with G7 as Ground (mirrors key colour)

WiFiManager config portal (hold button for 5 seconds)

OTA firmware updates (ArduinoOTA)

Auto deviceID: “AtomS3_XXXXXX” (from full MAC)

Companion v4 Satellite API: TEXT, KEY-STATE, COLOR/TEXTCOLOR, BRIGHTNESS, PING

v1.3 TEXT mode no longer requests bitmaps, reducing traffic and improving responsiveness

Hardware Connections
G8 – LED Red
G5 – LED Green
G6 – LED Blue
G7 – LED Ground
(Use a common-cathode RGB LED with G7 as ground.)

Installation & Usage

Flash firmware to the AtomS3.

On boot the device shows a startup screen, then “Waiting for Companion…”.

In Companion v4, go to Surfaces → Add Device → enter the displayed deviceID.

Hold the front button for 5 seconds to open the WiFi config portal.
(SSID = deviceID)

Configure Companion IP/port and choose display mode (bitmap or text).

Press the button to trigger the assigned action.
The external LED mirrors the Companion key’s colour.

In TEXT mode, set TEXT and COLOR/TEXTCOLOR in Companion — the device renders automatically.

Troubleshooting

LED colours wrong → Confirm wiring; must be common-cathode (G7 = Ground).

Not connecting → Check Companion IP/port and ensure both devices are on the same network.

Text shows only one letter → Update to v1.3, which fixes text rendering and removes bitmap fallback.

Version History
v1.3 – New text-only behaviour, no bitmap requests, faster rendering, improved font scaling.
v1.2 – General stability and UI tweaks.
v1.1 – Fixed LED PWM output.

name: M5 Cardputer Environmental Monitoring with BME 680 gas sensor
description:
See: https://www.blogger.com/blog/post/edit/4759435067747297899/3827130560033440934
This software is for the M5 Cardputer (original, but should work on the “advanced” model) and is an environmental monitoring system, saving data to an SD card and displaying it nicely on a webpage.

This software is for the M5 Cardputer (original, but should work on the “advanced” model) and is an environmental monitoring system, saving data to an SD card and displaying it nicely on a webpage.

It uses the BME 680 sensor, connected via the I2C for remote environmental monitoring. The cardputer is set up as a Webserver so that current readings can be seen on a webpage.

This software project is unfinished, but all the main features work well and survive a 24 hour soak test. I hope others can build on it! The code is weakly commented, but I hope it is readable.

Readings of pressure, temp and humidity are taken every minute (frequency not currently configurable) and saved in memory and to a CSV file, stored on the SD card, if one is present. The file is named based on the current date and a new CSV file is created at midnight.

On the home page, you can click the “Data and Charts” button which will allow you to view the last 24 hours of data and adjust the viewing start and end times for a nice graphical display.

Any CSV files saved on the SD card can be downloaded to your local machine.

Another page allows you to configure operational parameters for high and low alarms for temperature, pressure and humidity. An alarm sound is played from a WAV file through the cardputer’s speaker and an indication of the alarm is given on the home page.

The Cardputer’s display can show each of the environmental values in turn when you press any key, along with the device’s IP address on the network, once it is connected. The local time is determined by connecting to an NTP server.

The code is built from various examples given on the M5Stack website and forums as well as some other places.

The cardputer software uses 2 HTML files from the root folder of the SD card – “index.html” and “charts without data.html” These have placeholders for various bits of data such that the cardputer software fills them in with the relevant data. The chart data stored in memory is sent as a Javascript array so that the web page, when rendered, shows all the chart data. The chart display code was written by Chatgpt and modified a little to produce the relevant display, with start and end time zoom sliders!

I hope someone uses it to monitor their greenhouse or something!

Of course, you can set up port forwarding on your router and keep an eye on your greenhouse remotely!

Enjoy!

Andrew Johnson Dec 2025

name: M5 Cardputer IR Remote and Intervalometer for Digital Cameras

name: M5Apps
description:
Install with M5Burner!
v2.0
- CardPuter ADV support added
- Added new app FLOOD: advanced mesh chat with channels and history by ESP-NOW
- Added LED indicator for system event notifications (WiFi heart beat etc)
- Added screenshot option (key combination: CTRL + SPACE)
- Boot sound changed to smaller one (to free more space for other apps)
- Boot logo changed from BMP to PNG (to free even more space)
- FINDER: Improved progress during recursive deletition
- INSTALLER: Fixed HEAP corruption during cloud source browsing
- DIALOGS: Fixed ESC handling
- DIALOGS: Added maximum string size indication
- SETTINGS: Fixed error handling on import settings
- M5GFX driver updated (using new I2C master driver)
v1.9
- Added new app FINDER: two-panel file manager for SD card and USB drive
- Improved keyboard navigation in all apps
- Fixed keyboard sound issues
- INSTALLER: Added sorting files and folders by name
- INSTALLER: Cloud source fixed HTTP buffers
- FDISK: Added creation of new data partitions (press A)
- FDISK: No reboot required after deleting data partition
- Updated to the latest ESP-IDF v5.5.1
- Updated USB MSC driver
v1.8
- SETTINGS: Scroll position for selection dialogs fixed
- INSTALLER: Fixed bug with creating download directories
v1.7
- SETTINGS: Added export/import settings
- SETTINGS: Fixed rewriting other apps settings on export
v1.6
- Speed and stability improvements
- Minor UI fixes

v1.5
- Added version to boot animation
- Cloud source error messages are now more informative
- Minor UI fixes (hints, navigation, sound)

v1.4
- New soundsfor: boot, error, usb
- Minor UI changes (hints, scrolls, navigation)
- Now even more free space in flash for other apps

v1.3

- Fixed progress bar in dialogs
- Improved keyboard navigation in all apps
- FDISK: Added partition hex/ascii view mode
- FDISK: Added partition rename
- SETTINGS: Added hint for settings items
- SETTINGS: Added Installer settings to cusomize installation process
- SETTINGS: Added settings for tuning auto run on boot

  v1.2

- Added WiFi scan. Now can see all available networks and select it in Settings.
  Holding Fn will open manual network name dialog.
- WiFi disable by default
- Removed unicode from fonts. Freed much space in flash for other apps.
- Repository improvements: authors and apps collections are sorted now. App name includes name and version.

v1.1

- Added Settings app. Now can edit user settings
- Added screen dim by timeout. Usefull when charging the device. (Not active in dialogs)
- Added WiFi stack, Yes, it costs ~500Kb of space, but now can use remote repository.
  Thete is only M5Burner repo only, currently. But can add custom repos later.
- Added settings to dissable auto boot of last app

Flash your M5 Cardputer using your preferred source! This app supports remote repositories, SD cards, and USB drives, all within a convenient UI. Install up to 16 applications, limited only by your Cardputer flash size, and have them ready to run at any time.
Installation: this is full firmaware image bundle, thats why it has to be flashed with M5Burner or esptool offset 0
Source code: will be available soon.
Discussion: https://community.m5stack.com/topic/7388/m5apps-multiple-apps-installer

name: M5Cardputer WebRadio FR
description:
M5Cardputer WebRadio FR version
WiFi Settings will be stored in EEPROM
PlatformIO IDE used. (VS code)

Difficult to use an SD card for URL storage: The classic dilemma on ESP32:

Wi-Fi after SPI/SD_card = Wi-Fi fails
SPI/SD after Wi-Fi = SD fails
Why? On some boards like the M5Cardputer, SD access is done via HSPI, while Wi-Fi uses DMA/interrupts from the main bus. → When SD is initialized after Wi-Fi, the SPI bus or GPIO pins may conflict.

Implemented solution: Use an HTTP GET request to retrieve the list of channels: web-streams come from http://philae.synology.me/~admin/arduino/radio_dico.php

author: manba036

name: M5Core2_SimpleClock
description:
M5Stack M5Core2 Simple Clock

This is a very simple clock for the M5Core2
Usage

    Change parameters of ntpServer/gmtOffset_sec/daylightOffset_sec to your needs

    Change the WiFi mode as you wish, SMARTMODE = esp smartconfig, FIXEDMODE = static WiFi credentials

    Compile and push to the M5Core2

    M5Core2 will now show time based on the RTC time

    Touch the lower half of the M5Core2-LCD to bring up the menu icons

Menuicons

    WIFI Smart connect (touch on it [you see the clock stop], then press confirm on the ESP SmartConfig app on your phone, the icon will turn green if WIFI is done

    Time Sync (If WiFi icon is green, touch the TimeSync icon once), the icon will turn green if sync is done

    Close Menu (will hide the menu icons and disable the touch areas for the 3 icons)

Known problems

sometimes the WiFi is not working as expected, I tried to fix this by
restarting the complete WiFi but I'm not sure if this helps
I think this is some ESP32 issue, that sometimes cannot connect to WiFi

As I began with ESP chips I resetted the whole chip by using ESP.restart();
So this is my first attempt to fix it otherwise

name: M5Gemini
description:
M5Gemini - conversational AI Assistant for M5 Cardputer
v2.6
- Max string length limit fixed in edit dialog
v2.5
- Speach to text feature added using Deepgram API
- SETTINGS: fine tuning of STT
- SETTINGS: added separate volume level for system sounds and speach
v2.2

v2.0
- Integrated the ElevenLabs TTS API to provide high-quality and natural-sounding voice output for the AI assistant's responses
- History messages less bright to make focus on current message
- More customizable settings
- Export settings pays respect to other settings in file
- Settings list items now displays current value

Unlock the power of AI on your pocket PC with M5Gemini! This intuitive application provides a seamless experience for interacting with AI models using the Cardputer's keyboard input.
Key Features:
* Select Your Model: Choose from a variety of available AI models to suit your specific needs.
* Configurable Rules: Fine-tune the AI's behavior with customizable rules and parameters.
* Convenient Settings Menu: Access and adjust all app settings through an easy-to-navigate menu.
* M5Apps Compatibility: Settings are stored in a format compatible with other M5Apps, ensuring a consistent user experience.
* SD Card Import/Export: Easily backup and share your configurations by exporting settings to an SD card, or load existing settings with the import function.
Bring the intelligence of AI to your fingertips with M5Gemini on your M5 Cardputer!

name: M5GroqBot - *FREE* Online Groq Chatbot for *M5StickC Plus2* - LLM
description:
THIS IS VERY EASY... AND FREE! For M5StickC Plus2 Only!
M5GroqBot requires a free Groq API key to function. This guide will walk you through getting your key and configuring your device.
-Step 1: Get Your Free API Key
-Create a Groq Account
-Open your web browser on your computer or phone
-Navigate to the Groq Console:
https://console.groq.com/keys
-Sign up for a new Groq account (or log in if you already have one)
-The free tier is automatically available upon sign-up
-No credit card required
-Generous free usage limits
-Generate Your API Key
-Once logged in, you'll see the API Keys page
-Click the "Create API Key" button
-Give your key a descriptive name (e.g., M5GroqBot or M5StickC-Voice)
-Click "Create"
-⚠️ IMPORTANT: Copy the key immediately!
-The key looks like: gsk_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
>>>You won't be able to see it again after closing the dialog<<<
-Store it somewhere safe 

-Step 2: Flash Firmware to Your Device
-Step 3: Connect to Device WiFi Access Point
-After the firmware is flashed and the device restarts:

-Look at the M5StickC screen - it should display:

WiFi Setup...
Connect to:
M5GroqBot-Setup
On your phone or computer:

Open WiFi settings
Look for network named: M5GroqBot-Setup
Connect to it (no password required, if it does ask, it was groqbot123)
Wait for setup page to open automatically

If it doesn't auto-open, manually go to: http://192.168.4.1
Step 4: Configure WiFi and API Key
On the setup page you'll see:

WiFi Network dropdown

Select your home/office WiFi network
Enter the WiFi password
Groq API Key field

Paste your Groq API key here (the one you copied earlier)
Make sure there are no extra spaces before or after
Click "Save"

Device will save settings and restart
Takes about 5-10 seconds
Step 5: First Use
After restart, the device will:

Connect to your WiFi automatically

Displays the ready screen:

READY!
Ask me anything
With simple animation!

Press M5 Button to start recording
Speak your question clearly for 3 seconds
Get instant AI responses!
Scroll down by pressing the PWR button or bottom button
Scroll up by pressing R or top button
HOLD R to change colors of CHAT. 


THINGS YOU SHOULD KNOW.  Work in progress. I will probably update this project... Updated from 2 to 3 seconds recording. Color change settings now stay after reboot.  
I was STILL unable to get it to "continue" back to back questions. So what happens is when you ask a question it will prompt to reinitialize, after scrolling down, it takes just a few seconds to reconnect, its a little annoying. By pressing down just saves you the time of it not recording and then failing and rebooting. If you try to ask it another question it WILL also reconnect, it just takes longer and is a bit confusing as... it should work. 
I am going to still try to fix it. 
 It does not affect the way the chatbot works. It's one question at a time and NO memory at all.
 IF you do not speak clearly it may not do anything when it tries to translate, if it says ERROR Parse Failed it did not hear you.  I think the groq free tier is 30 request per hour. I have not maxed it out testing yet and have done a lot of testing. 

Have fun. 

Created by Coreymillia

name: M5HamRadio CoreS3
description:
The M5HamRadio project is a compilation, in one huge firmware, of my stable HamRadio projects on M5Stack. It include 4 applications for Icom IC-705, IC-7300 and IC-9700: ICSMeter (default application), ICMultiMeter, ICKeyer and DXTracker. All theses applications are available for free and for all. Please, take a look to the GitHub page for instructions. 

Support for the M5Stack Core S3 is still experimental. By the way, the M5Stack Core S3 only supports Bluetooth 5.0 (BLE - Bluetooth Low Energy), but not anymore Bluetooth 4.2 (Classic). Therefore, classical Bluetooth serial connexion won't work on the M5Stack Core S3. So, you will need to use ICUSBProxy(https://github.com/armel/ICUSBProxy). So, if you plan to use the Bluetooth connection, get an M5Stack Core or Core2 instead !

name: M5PEasyTag! for PaperS3
description:
Create your name tag with M5Paper series!

Using SD Card:
1. Put card.png into an SD card
2. Insert the SD card to the M5PaperS3/M5Paper
3. Reset/Turn power on

Using Wi-Fi Upload:
1. Tap the screen when prompted to setup Wi-Fi
2. Use the ESPTouch app on your smartphone to send Wi-Fi credentials
3. Use the upload form to send a new card.png
4. The device will automatically restart to display the new image

You can see additional instructions on the M5PaperS3/M5Paper by turning power on without SD card.

name: M5StickC - Companion v4 - Satellite Surface
description:
M5StickC Companion v4 Single-Button Satellite — a compact ESP32-powered satellite surface for Bitfocus Companion v4.  
- Uses M5StickC with built-in TFT display and single button (BtnA)  
- Displays text from Companion, with colour (bg + text) and adjustable brightness support  
- Auto-formats: ultra-large text (for 1–3 chars), large (4–6 chars), or up to 3-line layout; long text scrolls smoothly across bottom  
- Button sends KEY-PRESS events to Companion; no extra wiring needed  
- Stores Companion address in EEPROM and supports WiFi config portal via WiFiManager  
- Great for tally lights, live status, countdowns or simple show controls — portable, reusable, and easy to deploy.

M5StickC PLUS语音助理，按下M5StickC PLUS板载按钮37（按下开始录音，松开停止录音）可识别语音，发送到巴法云MQTT主题postvoice，同时订阅主题feedback可显示该主题消息，通过Nodered可实现语音万物（例如：语音说开灯，Nodered订阅postvoice主题收到消息后判断语音命令关键词执行开灯操作后，返回灯已打开……更多好玩用途等你开启）第一次使用需要通过M5Burner配置网络与腾讯云与巴法云账号，配置参数如下：
SSID WiFi名称
PASS WiFi密码
secretId 腾讯云SecretId
secretKey 腾讯云secretKey
client_id 巴法云私钥

腾讯云语音识别说明网址
https://cloud.tencent.com/product/asr
巴法云物联网平台地址
https://cloud.bemfa.com/?action=u_out
Nodered官网
