name: M5StickC Plus 1 Joystick-Mini With EspNow
description:
This project demonstrates ESP-NOW communication using the M5StickC Plus 1 with the M5 Mini JoyC module as a transmitter and an ESP32 WROOM as a receiver. The goal is to transmit the joystick states — including movements and button presses — to the receiver, where the information is displayed on the Serial Monitor.

Access git more details: https://github.com/rodrigopdcouto/M5-Joystick-Receiver-Test-Esp32-EspNow

name: M5StickC Plus 2 - Fishing Game
description:
Fishing Game for M5StickC Plus 2

This is another motion-controlled fishing game.

Features

- Motion Controls: Tilt to aim, swing to cast
- 12 Different Fish: Normal, Fast, Rare, and Golden types
- Weather Effects: Clear, rainy, and stormy conditions
- Combo System: Chain catches for bonus points

How to Play

- Menu: Press A to start

- Aim: Tilt device left/right to aim fishing rod

- Cast: Swing device to cast line

- Fish: Hold B to extend line, release to set hook

- Catch: Tap B rapidly when fish is hooked

Fish Types

Normal (10-20 points): Basic fish, easy to catch
Fast (25-30 points): Quick movement, harder to catch
Rare (50 points): Special patterns, purple indicator
Golden (100 points): Shimmering effect, highest value

Controls

Button A: Start game / Restart
Button B: Extend line / Rapid tap to catch
Tilt: Aim fishing rod
Swing: Cast line

name: M5StickC Plus 2 - Tilt Maze Game
description:
TILT MAZE for M5 StickC Plus2

Tilt to play the game. 

The goal is to make the white ball meet the green square.

How to play:
S1: Press Button B (M5) to start 
S2: Tilt the white ball through the maze to meet the green exit.

Note:
In the game, you can turn on and off the sound effect by pressing button B (m5) two times.

It will have 15 different levels from Easy to Hard.

You can create your Own Map by simply follow the structure:
0 = path
1 = wall
2 = trap
3 =exit
4 = start

Each maze is designed in a 7×12 grid

Enjoy!

I created this project to give the cardputer a bit of a Fallout PipBoy vibe.

Utilizing as a base the Official M5Cardputer-UserDemo project and the project https://github.com/WuSiYu/M5Cardputer-UserDemo-Plus, I created a new M5Cardputer-UserDemo Fallout-PipBoy Edition.

Instructions:

Press B to adjust Brightness.
Set Wifi to get SNTP time.
Press G0 Button to go home in any app.

With many new features such as: 
1. SNTP clock and stopwatch 
2. Integrated radio in the firmware with the ability to play radio in the background when pressing HOME (G0), press ESC to fully exit. 
3. Display battery voltage, current, and free heap size, adding a real feature to the WiFi icon 
4. A functional text editor that saves the file to the SD card.

Further down the line, I'll be adding more applications.
Still in development... More updates for the project coming soon!

About:
Pulls METAR data from aviationweather.gov. Please don't use this for anything involving aviation. Requires an SD card. And no, the character wearing the airline captain uniform is definitely not from a copyrighted tv show. 

Station:
Station settings require a 4 character ICAO code. Here's a massive list of US stations: https://weather.rap.ucar.edu/surface/stations.txt
For example, KONP is the station code for Newport Municipal Airport in Newport Oregon.   

Information about the acronyms can be found at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/METAR and the FAA website.

name: Manual Flash Calculator - ATOMS3
description:
v1.0.0:

If you use manual flash in your camera, this will calculate the settings to get the right exposure.

Inputs:

- Tilt left and right: Change the distance from the flash to the subject. Aperture is calculated based on GN, ISO, flash power and distance.
- Double click: Cycles through parameters for editing (GN, ISO, flash power and LCD brightness).
- Single click: Cycles through available values for the parameter that it's currently set for editing. GN from 1 to 64, ISO from 50 to 6400, flash power from 1/128 to full power, and 4 levels of brightness.
- Long click: Locks distance wheel, so you can adjust other settings and see the lens aperture value recalculated.

To save your current GN, ISO, flash power and brightness settings on the non-volatile memory, set the editing box on the brightness indicator and do a long click. This will save your config and reset the device.

v1.1.0:

- Added snap to distance wheel. Click when no other setting is selected and it will cycle through "no snap", 0.25m, 0.5m and 1m snap.
author: anibarro

name: Manual Flash Calculator - M5StickC Plus2
description:
v1.1.0:
Added basic battery level and turn off count down.

v1.0.0:
Adaptation from the AtomS3 version to use the extra screen space.
If you use manual flash on your camera, this will calculate the settings to get the right exposure.

Inputs:
- Tilt left and right: Change the distance from the flash to the subject. Aperture is calculated based on GN, ISO, flash power and distance.
- Click Button B (right side): Cycles through parameters for editing (GN, ISO, flash power and LCD brightness).
- Click Button A (central): Cycles through available values for the parameter that it's currently set for editing. GN from 1 to 64, ISO from 50 to 6400, flash power from 1/128 to full power, and 4 levels of brightness.
  When no setting is selected, it will cycle through "no snap", 0.25m, 0.5m and 1m snap.
- Long click Button A: Locks distance wheel, so you can adjust other settings and see the lens aperture value recalculated.
  Long click will save your current GN, ISO, flash power and brightness settings on the non-volatile memory when editing brightness. It will save your config and reset the device.

RX Pin: GPIO1 (Grove Port)
TX Pin: GPIO2 (Grove Port)

⚠️ Caution: The M5Cardputer operate at 3.3V logic levels. Connecting any UART device that uses a different voltage can damage the device. Always ensure that your connected UART device uses 3.3V.

description:
Pocket social microblogging platform for M5Cardputer.
Post messages, write comments, like posts, read the feed!

📝 Posts up to 120 characters
💬 Comments on any post
❤️ Likes with instant updates
📱 Sections: NEW, TOP, YOU

💸 Donate QR: press M or Enter on “MicroCast” header
ℹ️ Info window with quick help
Controls
; . Up/Down — scroll posts
, / Left/Right — switch sections
Enter — like/unlike or confirm section
C — open comments
Fn+Enter — new post / new comment
R — refresh
U — change username
N — add Wi‑Fi network
S — open Settings (YOU section)
M — open Donate QR
Opt+R — show Recovery Code
I — show Info window
ESC — back/close
First Run
Select Wi‑Fi network
Enter password
Choose username (3–24 chars)
Done!

v0.6 | M5Cardputer | MIT License

name: MicroHydra for Cardputer
description:
You should erase the flash before flashing this firmware for the first time.
IF YOU RUN INTO ISSUES: hold G0 as you plug it in to enter download mode. You'll then be able to re-flash this, or something new.  
Check out the wiki on the GitHub, if you have any questions :)

MicroHydra is an app switcher designed for MicroPython, with the goal of making it easy to create and switch between apps coded in MicroPython. It also provides some handy 'OS-like' features via a few built-in apps.

.py/.mpy files can be placed in the "apps" folder on the flash, or on an sdcard. There is also a new "getapps" builtin app for downloading from the community apps repo.

Check the GitHub if you have questions :) it has a community wiki going, along with a link to the app repo.
author: echolalia

name: MicroPython Shell for Cardputer ADV
description:
Use MicroPython REPL in Cardputer ADV, with build-in text editor.
Type edit() to open text editor. Press esc ( fn + ` ) to open menu in REPL and text editor. Press ctrl+[ ; . , / ] to scroll, fn+[ ; . , / ] to move cursor. Type run(filepath) to execute a Python file.

If you need to connect your device to Thonny, execute "dupterm() Stop" in the main menu first, and execute "dupterm() Start" after disconnect. If REPL has no respond, press ctrl+B.

For Cardputer ADV only.

NOTICE: Do not use timer 0 and 1 since they are used by the system internally.

UPDATE: Add screen brightness adjustment and 7 UI color to choose from.

name: MiniJoyCon and Robot Control Program for AtomS3
description:
Overview:
This is a shared program for both robot units and controllers. Double-clicking the A button switches between modes.
Supported M5 Devices:
• 	M5AtomS3 series
• 	M5Capsule
Compatible Accessories:
In addition to the supported M5 devices above, the following accessories (or equivalents with matching pin layouts) are assumed:
• 	5-servo connection board for M5Capsule
https://www.switch-science.com/products/9475
• 	4-servo connection board for M5ATOM
https://www.switch-science.com/products/9474
• 	Compact joystick controller board for M5ATOM S3 (board only)
https://www.switch-science.com/products/9522
Operation:
• 	[Robot Mode] While holding the A button, servos move (for operation check).
• 	[Controller Mode] Pressing the A button retrieves the battery level of a nearby robot.
※ Only effective for models with built-in batteries; not supported on Atom series.
• 	Double-clicking the A button cycles through modes for robot and controller use:
Left-hand controller → Right-hand controller → UGOKUPad → ESP-NOW (robot mode) → loop
• 	[Controller Mode] Long-pressing the A button registers a nearby powered-on robot.
※ If no robot is registered, commands are broadcast to all robots simultaneously.
Details:
https://sin1n24.hatenablog.com/entry/2025/10/18/231400
author: shinichi_nishimura 0

name: Mouse Jiggler OS
description:
Mouse Jiggler OS is a custom firmware for the M5StickC Plus2 that emulates a Bluetooth mouse.

-Bluetooth is ready for pairing the first time it boots, after it has persistent connection. 
-Splash screen at boot tells you if it shut down due to cold boot or  warm boot if timed out
-Turn on and off with C button long press
-B button is for menu, can be scrolled with B and A. 
-Interval, distance, sleep time out, and reset paring (allows new paring) can be selected with A button for confirmation from the menu. 
-Jiggle can be turned on or off with A button from the main screen, dot next to On/Off icon is a heartbeat indicator, this flashes whenever the mouse jiggles. 
-With time out active, after the selected time, pressing A to stop Jiggle turns off the OS to conserve battery
-Bluetooth, Jiggler on/off, and Battery are color coded
-Screen orientation is set to landscape, but moves with orientation of display. 

**Version 3.17 update 

-Includes scrolling of menu

GitHub: https://github.com/hsgarcia22/M5-MouseJiggler

name: OpenWiFi Scanner - Cardputer & ADV
description:
Works with both Cardputer models.

This tool continuously scans for open networks, searching for internet access, and generates a report of the surrounding Wi-Fi networks. It displays the detected networks, categorized by their security status.

SCREEN:
- Green: Indicates networks that provide open access to the internet.
- White: Indicates networks that are open without encryption but may not provide internet access.
- Orange: Indicates networks that use outdated or weak encryption, potentially at risk.
- Red: Indicates networks that are securely encrypted and protected.

LED:
- Green LED: Lights up when open networks or networks with web access are detected.
- Orange LED: Lights up when vulnerable networks are detected.
- Red LED: Lights up when only closed networks are found.

SPEAKER:
- One bip tone: Plays when a vulnerable network is detected.
- Two bip Tone: Plays when an open network is found.
- Melody tone: Plays when a web access network is available.


Disclaimer:

This tool is intended solely for educational and security purposes. It is designed to help users understand and assess the security of Wi-Fi networks. Do not use this tool to attempt unauthorized access to private networks. Unauthorized access to networks is illegal and unethical. Always obtain proper permission from the network owner before performing any scans or security assessments.

name: PORTAL.HACK DEMO M5STICKC PLUS
description:
### PORTAL.HACK DEMO Firmware

#### Introduction
This demo version of the PORTAL.HACK firmware is designed for security demonstrations and experimental testing. It includes a limited selection of advanced features, such as a depowered RF jammer, the Windows BLE Bad-USB attack, and various test WiFi and BLE functions. This firmware is developed for use with the M5StickC Plus and M5StickC Plus 2 devices, leveraging the capabilities of the ESP32 microcontroller through the Arduino IDE.

#### Included Features

1. **RF Jammer (Depowered)**
   - **Description**: Temporarily disrupts nearby radio signals in a controlled and limited manner.
   - **Usage**: Ideal for testing the effectiveness of RF security countermeasures in controlled environments without causing extensive interference.
   - **Hardware**: Requires the MX-RM-5V receiver module connected to pin 25 and the FS1000A transmitter module connected to pin 26.

2. **Windows BLE Bad-USB**
   - **Description**: Utilizes the M5StickC device to execute "BadUSB" attacks via Bluetooth.
   - **Usage**: The device creates a Wi-Fi network that you can connect to, then access the link http://172.0.0.1/ to input commands, which will be executed when the M5StickC is connected to a Windows PC via USB.

3. **WiFi and BLE Test Functions**
   - **WiFi Scan**: Scans for nearby WiFi networks and displays details such as SSID, signal strength, and security protocols.
   - **BLE Scan**: Scans for nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices, showing available devices and their characteristics.

#### Note
This firmware is intended for professional, educational, and demonstration purposes only. Unauthorized use of these features can violate laws and regulations. Always use responsibly and ethically.

name: Palnagotchi

*** THIS IS NOT A PWNAGOTCHI / ISSO NÃO É UM PWNAGOTCHI ***

author: viniciusbo

name: Palnagotchi for M5 Atom S3(R) Dev Kit
description:
A friendly unit for those lonely Pwnagotchis out there. It's written to run on the M5 Atom S3(R) Dev Kit.

This is a fork of viniciusbo's Palnagotchi for the M5 Cardputer.

He reverse engineered the Pwngrid advertisement protocol and made it possible for the Cardputer to advertise to the Pwngrid as a Pwnagotchi. All brain policy parameters that could negatively impact AI learning were removed from the advertisemenet data.

The Pwngrid works by sending Wifi beacon frames with a JSON serialized payload in Wifi AC headers, containing the Pwnagotchi's data (name, face, pwns, brain policy between others). That's how nearby Pwnagotchis can detect and also learn each other. By crafting a custom beacon frame, this app can appear as a Pwnagotchi to other Pwnagotchis.

name: Psychedelic Party Toy -Audio- Theramin Emulator- M5StickC Plus2
description:
MY attempt at a TheraminM5 🎵✨ 
Motion-Controlled Theremin with Psychedelic 3D Visuals for M5StickC Plus2

Transform your M5StickC Plus2 into a playable musical instrument! Tilt to create music with wild psychedelic frequency-reactive animations.

🎮 Features
🎵 Real-time Theremin Synthesis - Play music by tilting the device
🎶 Smooth Audio Engine - v1.3 
📐 IMU Motion Control - 6-axis accelerometer/gyroscope tilt detection
🌈 Psychedelic 3D Visuals - Frequency-reactive mesh animations
🎨 Dynamic Color Mapping - HSV colors respond to pitch
🔊 Volume by Tilt - Forward/back controls loudness
🎭 3 Visual Modes 
📊 Real-time Display - Live frequency and angle feedback
🔇 Instant On/Off - Toggle sound without stopping visuals
🎯 Quick Start

🎹 How to Play
Controls
Tilt Left/Right → Change pitch (200-1200Hz)
Tilt Forward/Back → Control volume (0-255)
Button A → Toggle sound ON/OFF
Button B → Cycle visual modes
Hold Power → Show help screen- or power off after 5 seconds
Tilt Mapping
        HIGHER VOLUME (tilt toward you)
                    ↑
                    |
    LOWER     ←  FLAT  →    HIGHER
    PITCH         |         PITCH
                  ↓
        LOWER VOLUME (tilt away)
Tips
Start with device flat to find center pitch
Tilt slowly for smooth frequency changes
Tilt backward (toward you) for maximum volume
Practice with sound off to learn movements
Hold device steady for sustained notes
🎨 Visual Modes
NOTE: I USED HECTOR for the visuals... BUT... IT IS NOT. I cannot explain what actually happened.

I also thought I was sending the audio through an external HAT speaker, the entire project. So at least now I know why another project didn't work. Either way, I failed to get that resolved and have my doubts it will be much better if it ever happens.  

That being said looks like it could be a cool party toy, I got the audio as smooth as possible, some of the peaks and other screens work better than others. Not so sure you can create music but you can do... something.  

IF you simply hate the audio but enjoy the designs you can use it upside down for for sound off.  

🎓 Inspired By
Original Theremin (Leon Theremin, 1920) - The world's first electronic instrument
Motion Sensing - Modern accelerometer adaptation of proximity sensing
Hector- and what was created using it. 
Synesthesia - Visual representation of sound frequency

name: QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Gateway
description: The program is composed of M5 BASIC host and Module LoRa (433MHz), which realizes the basic functions of the LoRaWAN470 gateway (single channel and sf). Its main function is: (1) Receive LoRa data packets from the LoRaWAN470 node (QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Node), convert into UDP data packets and upload to TTN (Uplink). (2) Receive UDP packets from TTN, convert into LoRa packets and send to the LoRaWAN470 node (Downlink). Users can configure the WiFi SSID and password, change the frequency and datarate and modify the LoRaWAN server address through burnerNVS.
author: M5Stack

name: QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Node
description: The program is composed of M5 BASIC host, Module LoRa (433MHz) and ENV-II Unit, which realizes the basic functions of the LoRaWAN470 node. Users can collect temperature and humidity data by the ENV-II Unit and communicate with TTN through the LoRaWAN gateway (QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Gateway). Users can configure the join mode (OTAA, ABP), frequency, datarate, power and transmission interval through burnerNVS to adapt different usage environments.

name: RF433/R/T
description:
The firmware is under development.

Functions:

RF433 Reading:

Select this option to read RF433MHz signals.
The device will display "Reading..." and wait for a signal.
When a signal is received, it will display the frequency in MHz.
Press button A or button C to return to the menu.

RF433 Emitter:

This function requires a valid frequency to be captured first.
If no valid frequency is captured, it will display a message indicating so.
If a valid frequency is available, it will emit a signal at that frequency.
Press button C to return to the menu.

RF433 Custom:

Allows manual control of the frequency.
Use button A to start transmitting at the current frequency.
Use button B to adjust the frequency. Press and hold to increase, press briefly to decrease.
The frequency range is from 432.500 MHz to 434.000 MHz.
Press button C to return to the menu.

The device will start with a menu displaying three options: "RF433 reading", "RF433 emitter", and "RF433 Custom".

Use button B to cycle through these options.
Use button A to select an option.
Use button C to return to the main menu from any operation.

name: SH. speedometer stick-c plus 2
description:
speedometer for a bicycle, motorcycle, etc. based on a Hall sensor

1. Required components:
M5StickC Plus 2: The device itself.
Hall sensor: For example, KY-024 (linear) or KY-003 (digital). For a speedometer, a digital sensor is better, which produces a clear HIGH/LOW signal when a magnet is detected.
Magnet: A neodymium magnet that will be attached to the wheel.
Connecting wires.
Grove cable (optional): If you are using the Grove port of the M5StickC Plus 2.
2. Connecting the Hall sensor:
The M5StickC Plus 2 has several available GPIO. We will use one of them.

VCC (power) of the Hall sensor -> 5V or 3.3V on the M5StickC Plus 2 (check the specification of your sensor).
GND (ground) of the Hall sensor -> GND on the M5StickC Plus 2.
OUT (signal pin) of the Hall sensor -> GPIO 32 on the M5StickC Plus 2. (GPIO 32 is available on the Grove port as SDA, but it can be used as a regular GPIO).

**Important:** Make sure that your Hall sensor produces a signal level compatible with the 3.3V logic of the ESP32. Most digital Hall sensors have a built-in comparator and work with 3.3V. If you have a 5V sensor, you may need a voltage divider on the signal line, but this is usually not necessary as the ESP32 is tolerant of 5V inputs up to a certain threshold.

name: Scorched Earth Vintage Game - M5StickC Plus2
description:
Scorched Earth M5 - Artillery Game
A turn-based artillery game for the M5StickC Plus2, featuring destructible terrain and tetrimino-styled graphics.

Overview
ScorchedM5 is a Scorched Earth-style artillery game where you face off against an AI opponent. Both players control upside-down T-shaped tetrimino tanks positioned on randomly generated destructible terrain. Take turns adjusting your angle and power to fire projectiles across the map and destroy your opponent.

Features
Destructible Terrain: Randomly generated landscapes with smooth terrain profiles
Turn-based Combat: Adjust angle and power, then fire at your opponent
Physics-based Projectiles: Realistic arc trajectory with gravity
AI Opponent: Computer-controlled enemy with randomized but strategic firing
Animated Sky: Scrolling clouds and tetrimino birds add atmosphere
Win/Loss Tracking: Keep track of your victories and defeats
Tetris-themed Graphics
Controls
M5StickC Plus2 Buttons:
Left Button (PWR): Decrease angle (move aim left)
Right Button (BtnB): Increase angle (move aim right)
M5 (BtnA): Cycle power (1-100%, hold to reverse direction)
Right Button: Fire projectile

Gameplay:
IN THIS ORDER!
1.Adjust your firing angle using Left/Right buttons (in 2.5% increments)
2.Set your power level using M5 button (in 2.5% increments) 
Hold M5 to go in lower increments, press M5 to raise it. 
3.Then press Right button to fire

Watch the projectile arc across the screen
AI takes its turn automatically
First to destroy opponent's tank wins!

Game Mechanics
Terrain Generation
Randomly generated smooth terrain using sine wave patterns
Different heights and profiles each game
Fully destructible - blocks removed by explosions
Tank Placement
Tanks spawn on opposite sides of the terrain
Always on solid ground
Random horizontal positions each game
Projectile Physics
Gravity affects trajectory
Angle range: adjustable via buttons
Power range: 1-100%
Explosion radius removes terrain blocks
AI Behavior
Calculates approximate trajectory to player
Adds randomization to power and angle
Becomes more accurate as game progresses
Avoids shooting directly off-screen
Win Conditions
Destroy opponent's tank with direct hit
Track wins and losses across multiple rounds
Terrain collapses are visual only (tanks don't fall)
Credits

Part of the Tetrimino game series for M5StickC Plus2:

Tetriminos - Space Invaders variant
TetriSnake - Snake with tetrimino obstacles
ScorchedM5 - Artillery combat (this project)
TetroidsM5 - Asteroids meets Tetris

I remembered playing this as a kid. Could not remember the name so it was built from memory. But there are a lot of similar ones like Scorched Earth. 

Colors are MUCH better than my gif here.  

Created by Coreymillia

name: Simple Magic 8-ball for M5StickC Plus2
description:
NOTE: INSTALL VIA LAUNCHER
(the burner version doesn't work for some reason)
💻 M5StickC Plus2 Magic 8-Ball: Optimized & Power-Managed

Project Overview 🪄

This project turns the M5StickC Plus2 into a classic Magic 8-Ball Uses the IMU to simulate the feeling of shaking a Magic 8-ball. Upon shaking, the scrteen will display a random answer. Icludes essential battery monitoring and quick access to time and brightness controls.

✨ Key Features and Power Optimizations

Quick Brightness Control - Button B (Short Press) on the main screen - Cycles brightness from 100 down to 1 (Night Mode)

Low-Flicker Clock/Battery - Automatic, Conditional Redraws - Prevents rapid screen updates and flicker on stable numbers, saving processing power.

Extreme Power Monitoring - Automatic - Battery percentage only updates when a 5% change is detected, drastically reducing redraw frequency.

Time Setup - Button A (Long Press ≥ 2s) - Dedicated, intuitive setup for adjusting the internal RTC clock.

Deep Sleep Mode - Automatic (60-second inactivity) - Maximizes battery life when idle.

🕹️ Controls Guide

Button A

Long Press (2s) - Enters Time Adjustment Mode and in the time set mode on the Time adjustment mode, tap to adjust the digits

Button B

on the main screen, use it to cycle the brightness in 25% increments
on the Time adjustment screen, tap to cycle Hour → Minute → Save → Exit

Shake the device to display a random Magic 8-ball answer~

description:
Play Sonic the Hedgehog Green Hill Zone Act 1 on M5StickC Plus2!

A complete port of Sonic The Hedgehog's first level for the M5StickC Plus2 with Mini Joy C Hat controller. Features authentic Sonic physics, optimized rendering, and the classic DOWN-TO-ROLL mechanic!

🆕 Features

name: Space-U CardComm
description:
ENGLISH
Embark on a thrilling space survival adventure game with Nora. As her only connection, your mission is to guide the stranded automation technician through the perilous corridors of the UR-13L space station. After a mysterious accident, Nora finds herself trapped in a dark, hostile environment, facing technical challenges, unknown creatures, and her own fears. Every decision you make will shape her fate: will she escape the doomed ship? Step into her shoes, solve puzzles, make critical choices, and immerse yourself in this suspenseful and exciting interactive narrative. Nora’s future is in your hands!

SPANISH
Embárcate en una emocionante aventura de supervivencia en el espacio con Nora. Como único contacto con la desafortunada técnica de automatización, tu misión será guiarla a través de los peligros de la estación espacial UR-13L. Tras un misterioso accidente, Nora se encuentra atrapada en un entorno oscuro y hostil, enfrentándose a desafíos técnicos, criaturas desconocidas y sus propios miedos. Cada decisión que tomes determinará su destino: ¿logrará escapar de la nave condenada? Ponte en su lugar, resuelve acertijos, toma decisiones críticas y experimenta el suspense y la emoción de esta experiencia narrativa interactiva. ¡El futuro de Nora está en tus manos!

name: StackChan(MP3-Player) for Cardputer & ADV
description:
NOW STACKCHAN CAN PLAY MP3 FILES CONTINUOUSLY AND NEW FACES HAVE BEEN ADDED. ADDED THE FUNCTION TO ADJUST SCREEN BRIGHTNESS. Keys (-) and (=).  ADDED SHUFFLE. Key - (s) 

!!! Brightness Fix !!!

StackChan came to liven up the cardputer's downtime when you're not using it for other things or when it's charging, and now it can groove to MP3s in the background. !!! READ MORE BELOW !!!

This means that when the device is recharging, it won't have a static background, and now you can listen to music while enjoying StackChan's cuteness.

Tip:
When a title balloon is being displayed, press any key to make it disappear.

Controls:

- Key 1 to change the faces
- Key 2 to change the background color
- Key 3 to change the expression 
- Press the '-' key to decrease brightness  
- Press the '=' key to increase brightness.

How to use MP3 Function:

- Copy MP3 files to the SD card, then insert it into the cardputer.
- Turn on the cardputer and wait a few seconds for it to scan.
- Press the (BtnGo) to play music.
- For the next song, press (BtnGo).
- Volume UP: press arrow up (;) 
- Volume DOWN: press arrow down (.)
- N for Next song
- B Previous song
- P Pause/Play
- S Shuffle ON/OFF


Note: still in development!!!

Libraries Dependencies:

- https://github.com/meganetaaan/m5stack-avatar
- https://github.com/earlephilhower/ESP8266Audio/

author: Coreymillia

name: TETRIS! Single OR Multi-Player Battle!+ - M5StickC Plus2
description:
TETRIS! MULTI-PLAYER!

*There is still a single player mode!

This project represents a significant evolution from a single-player M5StickC Plus2 Tetris game to a full-featured 2-player battle system. While built upon AleksAlcDel's excellent foundation and inspired by Hexagon's advanced concepts, the battle system, enhanced features, and professional polish represent substantial original contribution to the M5Stack Tetris Community. 

*REQUIRES Mini JoyC Hat!
-Multi-Player *Requires 2nd M5StickC Plus2
TO CONNECT- After booting opening screen. First hold down on the JoyC Hat. Then WAIT! about 15-20 seconds and it will create a hotspot. Shortly afterward hold down on JoyC hat on 2nd M5Stick, it will connect quickly. They are supposed to ready up together. Sometimes they do. Sometimes one person opens a few seconds earlier. No matter what the game syncs up and the battle begins. I would however not delay a long time after connecting to each other to ready up.

-20 Levels
-Ghost Piece
-Next Piece  *only displays for a second. Not intentional. 
-Border- to fill the void on the original
-A battle meter! I don't actually know what this does. 
-You can each select your own levels! For multi skill level users. 
-GARBAGE! Clearing. 2 Lines sends ,  3 lines sends 2 and 4 lines sends 4! I was going to make T-spins send 4. But its really not fair, as they are so easy. 
-Press Left button for hold next piece!
-M5 pauses it game
*note: pausing one game does NOT pause the other

-Progressive lock delay! I think it works. not a huge fan of slow speeds, so I really only could tell on the higher level. But its set to go from 450 ms to 650ms at Max level. 
-There is also a left over WiFi monitor hold up... and Tetris beacon on the opening screen if you hold L+R. So. Don't do that unless you want the world to know someone is playing Tetris nearby. 

Only for M5StickC Plus2

Created by Coreymillia
author: Coreymillia

name: TETRIS_PRO! Hold + Next Piece + Ghost - *Level Select 0-20* - M5StickC Plus2
description:
TETRIS_PRO!
**Requires Mini Joy-C Hat!**
 ***Displaying NEXT piece!***
-Level Selection 0-21
-***HOLD Piece Press M5***
-.750ms Piece lock delay to give it a modern feel and faster play
-Press UP on Joystick for hard drop
-Press Joy button to rotate right
-Press L button to rotate left 

-Starts faster and MUCH faster levels
-Piece colors change every time you clear a line... was unintended but I did not try to fix it. This may cause a slight pause when you get a Tetris.
-T-Spins work both directions!

*Only for M5StickC Plus2

Made from firmware by AleksAlcDel

Modified by Coreymillia
author: Coreymillia

name: TETROIDS! Asteroids Tetris Piece Game M5StickC Plus2
description:
**Mini Joy C Hat Required!!**
TetroidsM5 - Tetris meets Asteroids
A space shooter for M5StickC Plus2 where you pilot a T-piece ship through waves of Tetris asteroid attacks!

  🎮 Game Description
Control a T-piece spaceship that rotates 360° and fires bullets to destroy incoming Tetris-shaped asteroids. Survive waves of tetromino enemies, break them apart, and rack up your high score! Classic arcade action meets block-puzzle aesthetics in this retro-inspired shooter.

🌟 Key Features
360° Ship Rotation - 8-direction smooth rotation with momentum physics
Asteroid Destruction - Shoot Tetris pieces that break into smaller blocks
Progressive Waves - Increasing difficulty with more asteroids
Tetris Aesthetics - Classic piece colors (I=Cyan, O=Yellow, L=Orange, J=Blue, S=Green, Z=Red)
Screen Wrapping - True Asteroids-style edge teleportation
God Mode - Invincibility toggle for testing/practice
Smooth 60 FPS - Buttery gameplay on ESP32
🕹️ Controls
Input	Action
Joystick Left/Right	Rotate ship counter-clockwise/clockwise
Joystick Up	Thrust forward (momentum physics)
Joy Button	Fire bullet (max 4 on screen)
M5  Warp/hyperspace
Button B	Toggle God Mode (invincibility)

How to Play
Survive the Waves - Each wave spawns 3-8 Tetris-shaped asteroids
Shoot to Break - Hit large asteroids to break them into 4 smaller blocks
Destroy All - Clear all asteroids to advance to next wave
Avoid Collisions - Touching asteroids damages you (unless God Mode is on)
Score Points:
Small block destroyed: 10 pts
Large asteroid broken: 50 pts
Wave completed: 100 × wave number
Survival time: 1 pt/second

Design Philosophy
This game combines the best of two arcade classics:
Asteroids (1979): Rotation, thrust, screen wrap, shooting
Tetris (1984): Block aesthetics, piece types, colors
Atari's Asteroids & Alexey Pajitnov's Tetris

Created by Coreymillia

name: Tetrimino Space Invaders Game - M5StickC Plus2
description:
TETRIMINO SPACE INVADERS!
 v1.2
**Requires Mini JoyC Hat**
💥 Particle explosion system - Colorful particles on every hit
🎯 Individual block destruction - Shoot enemies one block at a time
🎨 Random enemy positioning - Organic, scattered formations
💀 Death animations - Player explodes into particles when hit
⏱️ Respawn delay - 2.5 second visual explosion before respawning
🎮 Bottom border - Clean visual floor at screen bottom
✨ Polish - Fixed pixel artifacts and visual glitches

-Game Features
Core Gameplay
Classic Space Invaders with Tetris theme
T-piece player ship at bottom
Enemy formation of small Tetrimino pieces (9×4 grid)
Vertical shooting mechanic
3 lives to start (max 5 with bonuses)
Progressive Difficulty
Wave 1: No enemy shooting, slow movement (800ms delay)
Wave 2: Light enemy shooting (30% chance), faster (750ms)
Wave 3-4: Moderate shooting (50% chance), faster (700-650ms)
Wave 5+: Heavy shooting (80% chance), very fast (600ms+)

-Scoring System
10 points per enemy destroyed
100 points per wave completed
Bonus life every 1000 points (max 5 lives)
Controls
Joystick Left/Right: Move ship horizontally
Joystick Button: Shoot projectile upward
Right Button -Toggle God Mode (invincibility)
M5 - Restart game (when game over)
Enemy Shooting System
Starts at Wave 2
Only frontmost enemies in each column can shoot
Red bullets travel downward
Frequency increases with wave number -射击间隔: 2 seconds minimum between shots
Visual Indicators
Lives: Red squares at top right
Wave: Top left (W#)
Score: Top center (S:#)
God Mode: Yellow bar below HUD
Enemy Alert: Red "!" when enemies can shoot (Wave 2+)
Bonus Life: Green "BONUS LIFE!" message appears (2 seconds)

Based on 1978 Space Invaders by Midway Manufacturing

Created by Coreymillia

name: ThreeTris - Ultimate 3-Block Tetris Game *M5StickC Plus2*
description:
ThreeTris v3.3🎮
The Ultimate 3-Block Tetris Game for M5StickC Plus2
*Requires Mini JoyC Hat*

A modern, feature-complete implementation of ThreeTris (Triomino Tetris) with 8 unique pieces, and advanced gameplay mechanics.

🎯 Core Gameplay
8 Unique Triomino Pieces - More variety than the original!
Perfect Rotation System - All pieces rotate clockwise smoothly
Modern Tetris Mechanics - Hold piece, next piece preview, ghost piece
Endless Gameplay - Play forever with progressive difficulty
Score & Level Tracking - Complete statistics display

⚡ Progressive Difficulty
Dynamic Lock Delay - Gets harder as you progress (300ms → 600ms)
Speed Progression - Levels 1-20 gradually increase speed
Endless Challenge - Speed caps at level 20, game continues forever
🎮 Gameplay
ThreeTris is a unique twist on classic Tetris using only triomino pieces (1-3 blocks each). Stack pieces to clear lines and increase your score. The game features modern mechanics like:

Hold System - Save a piece for later
Next Preview - See what's coming
Ghost Piece - Shows where piece will land
Progressive Difficulty - Lock delay increases with level
Scoring System
Clear lines to earn points
Level up every 10 lines
Track your high score
Endless gameplay for maximum scores

Controls
Title Screen
JoyC Button - Start game
In-Game
Control-------------------Action
JoyC UP---------------------  Hard drop
JoyC Left/Right	Move piece horizontally
JoyC Button	----------Rotate piece clockwise
JoyC Down---------------Soft drop (faster fall)
Button A (M5)	Hold piece 
🧩 Game Pieces
ThreeTris features 8 unique triomino pieces, all with exactly 1-3 blocks:

#	Name	Blocks	Shape	Color
1	I-Triomino	3	###	Cyan
2	L-Triomino	3	#.. #.. ##.	Blue
3	J-Triomino	3	..# ..# .##	Orange
4	Single Block	1	#	Yellow
5	Double Block	2	##	Green
6	Diagonal Double	2	#. .#	Red
7	Diagonal Triple	3	#.. .#. ..#	Purple
8	T-minus-one	3	### .#.	White

Credit:
I built this from memory from an old romhack for gb and nes. Unable to find info on who created it. One additional corner piece added. PLUS all modern mechanics. 

Created by Coreymillia

name: Timer Camera X网络视频服务器
description:
该固件为Arduino IDE默认测试程序CameraWebServer可以通过网页在线配置摄像头滤镜镜像等，可以通过该固件轻松获取视频流或者实时照片，关于该固件的更多实用用法见默言博客，点击下方GitHub图标直达博客。
固件使用步骤如下:
1、烧录该固件并通过M5 NVS配网
2、打开串口监视器，连接Timer Camera X串口并重启开发板
3、通过串口监视器或者路由器后台查看IP地址
4、浏览器访问设备IP地址进入摄像头Web管理后台进行使用

注意事项：
一般来说图片分辨率越高视频流帧率越低
通过水平镜像或者垂直镜像设置不同方向
视频流地址http://<IP地址>:81/stream
实时照片地址http://<IP地址>/capture

NVS配置需要先初始化NVS
wifi名称配置SSID
wifi密码配置PASS

name: Ultimate Remote - Cardputer & ADV
description:
Works with both cardputer models.

A powerful universal remote control for the M5Cardputer, supporting 3498 remote profiles from 636 different manufacturers and containing around 30,000 commands. It allows you to easily find a suitable remote for you device thanks to a automatic remotes scan.

!! NEW !! - UPDATE 1.2 : Support for the Flipper-IRDB, read .ir files form SD card, also new remotes added.

## Key Features

- Extensive Database: Contains 3498 remote profiles from 636 different manufacturers.
- Protocol Support: Works with more than 60 infrared protocols.
- Massive Command Set: Supports around 30,000 commands.
- Read .ir files from SD card (See Github to get theses files).
- Scan and Find: Allows you to scan for and find the correct remote from a particular manufacturer.
- Favorites: Easily add remotes by pressing SPACE on any remote add it to your favorites.
- Navigation: Navigate through different manufacturer folders to view all available remotes and save them.

## Keybinds

Remote's shortcuts are automatically assigned, however, keys like POWER will always have the shortcut 'P', CHANNEL_UP and CHANNEL_DOWN will always be '[' and ']', and VOL_UP and VOL_DOWN will always be '-+', the same goes for KEY_0 to KEY_9 and some others frequently used commands.
author: geo_tp

name: Ultrasonic Wind Sensor - ULSA M5B (Demo Firmware)
description:
This firmware is a demonstration firmware for the ULSA M5B, an ultrasonic anemometer that can stack with the M5Stack Core2.
It provides a wind speed and direction gauge, as well as a wind direction correction feature using the Bosch 9-axis sensor BNO055 built into the ULSA.
This firmware is compatible with Core2, Core2 for AWS, and Core2 V1.1.

[Version 2.2 - 2025/10/21]
 - Added support for FAT16 file count limitation
 - Fixed BLE device name bug
 - Improved stability for long-term operation

[Version 2.1 - 2025/09/28]
 - Fixed a bug where, depending on SD card compatibility, log files could suffer data loss or be created as empty files.

 - Changed the logging method to output in 15-minute segments instead of a single file.

 - Implemented an external-power-only mode (“EXT”). When the ULSA is powered via the device’s micro-B port, charging of the internal battery is disabled. This prevents unexpected reboots caused by conflicts between charging and discharging of the internal battery. Tap the battery icon to switch to EXT mode.

[Version 2.0 - 2024/08/04]

 - Supports BLE wireless connection
 - Supports automatic time synchronization via BLE (syncs with the built-in RTC)
 - Supports CSV data logging to an SD card

By accessing the ULSA BLE site using the Web Bluetooth API (https://strvsn.net/P5/ULSA_BLE/), wireless measurement and wireless logging via the browser are possible.

Supported browsers:
PC: Chrome, Edge
Android: Chrome
iOS: Bluefy (logging function not supported)

name: Vesc pocket display
description:
A compact real-time dashboard for VESC-based e-bikes, scooters, or carts, built around the M5StickC Plus2 (ESP32-PICO-V3-02).
This version focuses on readability and performance — no clutter, no bars, just the key live metrics that matter while riding.

🧠 Features

Voltage & Wattage: live battery and power draw from VESC telemetry

MOSFET & Motor Temps: shows controller and motor temperature

Duty Cycle %: live duty output from the controller

Speed (MPH): computed from ERPM using your motor parameters

ESP32 Battery Level: displayed in the top-right corner

BLE Telemetry: communicates with the VESC via Nordic UART Service (NUS)

Update Rate: ~5 Hz (200 ms polling interval)

Minimal UI: clean text layout optimized for sunlight visibility on the M5Stick’s small TFT

🔧 Hardware

M5StickC Plus2 (ESP32-PICO-V3-02)

VESC-compatible controller (UART / BLE enabled)

Optional: custom enclosure or mount for handlebars

📡 Software Stack

M5Unified (display, battery)

NimBLE-Arduino (BLE NUS communication)

Written in Arduino C++, designed for simplicity and reliability

🏁 Usage

Flash the sketch to your M5StickC Plus2.

Power on your VESC with BLE enabled.

The M5Stick automatically scans and connects to your VESC.

Watch live data — voltage, watts, temps, duty, speed, and onboard battery %.

name: WaveFlow Player For TAB5
description:
# JPEG Viewer & MP3 Plaer for M5Stack Tab5

## USAGE:

**Step1:** User Python Script Convert the JPEG Files to 1280x720 in BASELINE Format. (You Can Download the Python Script from Github)

**Step2:** Copy Converted JPEG Files to TF CARD `/jpeg` Directory (Supports Subdirectories).

**Step3:** Simply Swipe Up or Down on the RIGHT SIDE of the Screen to Navigate Images.

---

# MP3 Player for M5Stack Tab5

## USAGE:

**Step1:** Copy MP3 Files to TF CARD `/mp3` Directory (Supports Subdirectories).

**Step2:** Double-Click Any MP3 File in the List to Play.

**Step3:** Use Prev/Next Buttons to Switch Songs, Drag Volume Slider to Adjust Volume.

**Step4:** Click "Lock Screen" Button or Swipe Down at Top-Center to Turn Off Screen (Music Keeps Playing).

MP3 Conversion for WaveFlow Player
Problem: Some MP3 files may not play due to format issues.
Solution: Convert your files using FFmpeg.
Quick Steps:
1、Visit the official FFmpeg website and Install FFMpeg: https://ffmpeg.org/download.html
2、Download the Conversion Script from Github : https://github.com/musicaJack/M5Stack_Tab5_Converter/blob/main/mp3_convert.py
3、Place the Python script​ (mp3_convert.py) in the same directory with your MP3 files
4、Run the conversion script: python mp3_convert.py
5、Copy fixed mp3 files to TF Card in mp3 directory

name: XReader for paperS3
description:
An e-ink reader for M5 paperS3. 
Now it just supports Chinese UI and EPUB format.
---------------------------------------------------------------
XReader阅读器

1. 书籍文件请放在book根目录下，暂时只支持epub格式
2. 图片文件请放在pic根目录下，暂时只支持jpg/jpeg/png格式

Baseline版本说明：
1. 这个版本只是作为基线，还有很多需要完善的地方
2. 自定义字体和优化刷新闪烁将作为高优先级问题加快解决

修改日志（2025.12.8）：
1. 改进epub适配性
2. 支持二级目录显示和跳转
3. 优化排版，行首不出现标点符号
4. 支持阅读界面的文字下划线（默认显示，可关闭）
5. 增加阅读书籍时图片的显示方式切换（裁剪填充或不裁剪显示完整）
6. 书架长按书名支持【重新阅读】或【删除书籍】
7. 延长滑动手势的判断距离，避免误触
8. 自动过滤由MacOS系统自动生成的"._"开头文件
9. 更多细节修改不再赘述，可以在不同界面左滑查看帮助说明

name: Yamb game for the cardputer ( Yahtzee game )
description:
A cool little game to install on your cardputer

*Disclaimer* : If you want the game to have dice rolling sounds and
to make sounds when you unselect all the die you have to mp3 files
to the sd card and name them "dice_rolling.mp3" and "magical.mp3"

I recommend using these:
(Shoutout to the creators of those sounds)
dice sound - https://pixabay.com/sound-effects/dice-142528/
magical sound - https://pixabay.com/sound-effects/magical-twinkle-242245/

Choose numbers 5-9 to select with how many dice you want to play
Then functional keys are:
h - help menu
1-9 - to select or deselect the wanted dice
p - to display the current points
m - to mute the device
c - to deselect all the selected die 
r - to reset the game

This is the first version, but the firmware will be updated soon!

v0.40 - 28 july 2025
Modular firmware for M5Stack Paper/PaperS3 devices featuring customizable badge functionality with BMP/TXT file display, comprehensive SD card file management, built-in applications (calculator, text reader, geometry test, swipe test, font test), built-in games (6x6 Sudoku with number keyboard, classic Minesweeper 10x15 grid with 25 mines, test game), Wi-Fi connectivity with network scanning, and SD Gateway web interface for remote file upload/download/editing operations. Includes touch-based navigation, battery monitoring, screen rotation, multilingual support, and modular architecture with separate components for screens, buttons, keyboards, games, and services. Uses M5Unified v.0.2.7 and M5GFX v.0.2.9 libraries.

name: io443 v2
description:
IO433 is an open-source ESP32 (TTGO T-Display) & CC1101 based 433Mhz sniffer. It is currently work in progress. It can sniff, store, replay, dump and monitor most 433Mhz (currently ASK-OOK only) signals. These include garage door openers, remote doorbells, sensors and similar devices.

The core of this project aims to be its simplicity, reliability and versatility. With a couple of ICs and a by 'connecting some wires', or soldering a breakout board, one can start messing around with 433Mhz devices and decode their communications protocols. It's mainly a proof-of-concept but already encompasses several very useful features.

name: uart buddy
description:
This software is part of the integrated training developed by Julio Della Flora (@juliodellaflora on Instagram) and is designed to assist hardware hackers in discovering and interacting with UART (Universal Asynchronous Receiver-Transmitter) serial ports on embedded devices using an M5Stack device. The program allows users to toggle between various common UART baud rates, enabling communication with different serial devices. It also sends commands like "help" via the UART connection to test responses and displays the received data in real-time on the M5Stack's screen.

The baud rates supported include 9600, 115200, 230400, 256000, 512000, and 921600. The tool logs all UART activity, saving the logs to an SD card for later review. Additionally, the M5Stack’s screen displays real-time status, such as the battery level, and logs are printed on the screen as data is received. The software uses buttons to switch baud rates and trigger data transmission, making it an intuitive interface for exploring UART connections in embedded devices.

This software is part of the free training developed by Julio Della Flora (@juliodellaflora on Instagram), and you can check out the full training at the following link

name: world market clock
description:
It is a 24-hour clock for employees or managers of import/export companies, and those who work in trade clerical work.

The analog clock shows Greenwich Mean Time and the digital clock shows the three major markets of the world:New York,London and Tokyo. The clock face(background) displays the trading hours of each country's market and a map centered on the North Pole.(The hour hand(short hand) indicates the position of the sun.)
It seems that there is still no world clock that integrates these four elements and displays them. There is no complexity at all, rather it is intuitive to see and understand, and it greatly helps you to image the local time and trading situation of each market around the world.

Local time is displayed at the right of the clock face, and rate of 4 major currencies(3 currency pairs) are displayed in real time.
The LED on the side changes color according to market fluctuations(green→orange→red). Even if you don't pay attention to the rate numbers all the time, it is possible to grasp the mood of the market.
In addition, the world clock automatically switches between standard time, daylight saving time, and trading time display for each country's market under the following conditions.

Second Sunday in March: New York, Toronto, Chicago. Transition to daylight saving time.
Last Sunday in March: London, Zurich, Frankfurt. Transition to daylight saving time.
First Sunday in April: Wellington, Sydney. Transition to standard time.
Last Sunday in September: Wellington. Transition to dylight saving time.
Last Sunday in October: London, Zurich, Frankfurt. Transition to standard time.
First Sunday in November: New York, Toronto, Chicago. Transition to standard time.

There is also a normal world clock mode that does not display currency rates, and a local time display mode (used when setting local time).

Requires an SD card. Also download the clock face image ZIP on github.
A detailed explanation is also written on github.


0.0.5 : Made available in core2 V1.1
0.0.6 : Shortened exchange rate acquisition interval from 10 seconds to 5 seconds

name: 创意点阵时钟（2合1）
description:
引脚定义:

模式选择引脚33(悬空为普通模式，低电平为悬浮模式)

http://maker.peien.xyz/clock/
普通取模逆向 悬浮顺向

使用步骤:
1、按要求连接点阵与按需选择模式将GPIO33悬空或接地选择模式
2、上电设备开启名称为M5_XXX的热点，XXX为设备MAC地址，连接该热点，浏览器输入192.168.4.1进入在线配置页面，配置网络与显示亮度
3、配置完成断电重启自动联网后可通过路由器分配的IP地址在线配置与使用

默认设置
网络Netcore-65080F密码1234567890
亮度1

name: 悬浮点阵时钟plus
description:
该固件与上一版本相比增加了时钟的控制API
可以通过网络get请求时钟IP地址提交参数控制
时钟的亮度以及显示32x8的位图
参数定义如下：
state（定义显示时间或者显示位图，值为1显示时间，值为0显示位图）
image（显示位图的16进制数据，高度必须为8宽度0-32的位图，显示位图state参数必为0）
luminance（显示亮度范围0-10，0为最暗而不是不亮）
固件使用步骤如下:
1、连接4合1点阵DIN→19 CLK→21 CS→22
2、烧录该固件并通过M5 NVS配网
3、重启开始使用悬浮创意精灵时钟
4、通过设备IP加提交参数控制悬浮创意精灵时钟（例如http://192.168.0.110?state=0&image=0x20, 0x60, 0xC8, 0xDB, 0xDB, 0xC8, 0x60, 0x20, 0x00, 0x00, 0x0E, 0x18, 0xBE, 0x6D, 0x3C, 0x6D, 0xBE, 0x18, 0x0E&luminance=2）
增加网络未连接超时60秒重启（适用于已连接但由于网络波动等情况造成的意外断开等情况，此种情况，网络环境并未改变）

name: 阅读卡片 | EDC Book
description:
【软件信息】
阅读卡片/EDC Book。一款基于M5 PaperS3的墨水屏阅读器软件。

v1.4.1 更新日志
[特性] 支持idx外挂目录（idx生成方式请在Chrome/Edge/Firefox插件市场搜索楚大的ReadPaper Utils插件）
[特性] 新增触屏解锁（请仔细阅读关于功能说明里关于耗电的提示，酌情使用）
[特性] 新增阅读时长统计
[特性] 点击进度预览栏快速跳转进度
[特性] 底部功能区滑动快速翻页（仅默认字体支持）
[优化] 全面优化所有模式下的翻页速度和残影控制
[优化] 支持更多的txt编码格式（UTF16LE/UTF16BE/BIG5，原生支持，无需转码）
[优化] 默认字体的大小限制从8M增加到10M

变更说明
删除文件编码菜单，全部自动识别

【更多信息】
http://edcbook.cn

【Software Information】
EDC Book. An e-ink reader application based on M5 PaperS3.

v1.4.0 Changelog
[Feature] Support for external IDX directories (Search for "ReadPaper Utils" extension in Chrome/Edge/Firefox to generate IDX files)
[Feature] Added touch screen unlock (Please read the power consumption notes in the function description carefully and use judiciously)
[Feature] Added reading duration statistics
[Feature] Tap progress preview bar for quick jumping
[Feature] Swipe in bottom functional area for fast page turning (only supported with default font)
[Optimize] Comprehensive optimization of page turning speed and ghosting control in all modes
[Optimize] Support for more TXT encoding formats (UTF16LE/UTF16BE/BIG5, native support, no conversion needed)
[Optimize] Default font size limit increased from 8M to 10M

Changes
Removed file encoding menu, all automatically recognized

【More Information】
http://edcbook.com
author: mengxiyou

name: ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ BTスピーカー bluetooth-simple (CORE2 for AWS & CORE2 V1.1)
description:
Ver3.1：LEDエフェクトをマルチタスク対応にし負荷分散化しました。

ｱｦｯｺさん仕様をアップロードしました。LED 70弾に対応しました。ネコミミLEDで遊べます。
エフェクト切り替えは、ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝの顔中央左側をタップして変更します。(それぞれのエフェクトはGitHubにリンク貼りました。)

起動時: RAINBOW→COMET→LARSON→CHASE→PULSE→STATIC→FILLIN→GLOW→STOROBE→SINEWAVE→RANDOM
→TRIWAVE→FADEINOUT→NANAIRO→MERAMERA→FIRE→BOUNCING→NONE(一旦停止)→RAINBOW…
で順番にスイッチします。ぜひお気に入りでビカビカさせてみてくださいｗ

～～～～～
このファームウェアは、M5Stack Core2 for AWS専用に作成されています。(M5Stack Core2＋M5GoBottom2モジュールの組み合わせでも動作可)
ベースはタカオさん制作のBTスピーカーなｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ stackchan-bluetooth-simple、その後robo8080さんが顔変更やレベルゲージ機能を追加したものにLED点灯のエフェクトを
追加したファームウェアを用意しました。まずはLED等を含めた動作確認等にご利用ください。(Port設定や初期値の音量等は状況に合わせYAMLファイルで調整下さい。)
操作方法等はGitHubリンク先のREADMEをご覧ください。現在、画面中央左部をタップすると7種のLEDエフェクトを操作することができます。
また内蔵LEDを点灯させるファームの他、Port.B、Port.Cを使った場合のファームも公開中です。(右側で選択ください)
author: t_mac116

versions.version: Xmaxイルミネーション仕様 Ver2.1 (Port.B LED×60＆Port.C LED×60)
ｱｦｯｺさん仕様 Ver3.1 (Port.B LEDx70 & Port.C LEDx70)

name: ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ(ランダムwav再生）
description:
【注意】Core2 Ver.1.1では動きません。
独り言を言うｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝです。セリフをSDカードにwavファイルで入れておくとランダムに再生します。
【使い方】
* サーボはPORT.Aに接続してください。
* SDカードに、wavというディレクトリを作りそこにwavファイルを入れておきます。
* wavファイルのサンプリング周波数は16khzか24khzにしてください。
* ファイル名に全角文字や長いファイル名はつかえません。
* サンプルのwavファイルがGithuのwavディレクトリに入っています。
author: robo8080

name: ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝRadikoプレイヤー
description:
【注意】Core2 Ver.1.1では動きません。
You can listen to radiko with Stack-Chan.
Note: Can only be used in Japan.
M5Stack Core2 ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝで動きます。
サーボはPORT.Aに接続してください。
Wi-Fiの設定はSmartConfigを使用、
iOSかAndroidの「Espressif Esptouch」アプリから設定します。
ボタンA：選曲　ボタンA長押し：音量＋　ボタンB：音量ー
レベルメーター表示部にタッチすると、レベルメーター表示をON/OFFできます。
画面中央にタッチすると首振りを止めます。
レベルメーター表示OFFの時、画面下部にタッチするとバルーンでラジオ局名を表示します。
画面右端の中央付近にタッチするとFaceを切り替えられます。
author: robo8080
